I'm not the least disappointed.

Family-run restaurant is small with just 6 or 7 tables. Be prepared o share table during lunch time. The Bun Cha Gio Thit Nuong (BBQ Pork & Imperial Roll dry vermicelli)  ($7.50) was pretty good. Compared to Golden King, the imperial rolls are much crispier on the outside and the filling more flavorful. The filling also doesn't have that overwhelming fish-sauce taste. Pork is BBQ to perfection but I wish it has more crusty charred edges. It certainly hit the spot.

Note to self: Imperial roll here is tastier than that of Golden King (Clay/Grant), Cordon Bleu (California/Polk), but not as good as Thanh Tam II (Valencia/17th).

Cash only. They do a snappy take-out.
author: Matt Y.

description: Love this place !! Crab noodle soup is so delicious !!! And they open until late :) I always crave this soup late at night ! Only thing bad about this place is the parking :(
author: Jenny L.

description:
The only thing here that is extremely memorable, and I salivate as I write this!!!!.... is the steak carpaccio appetizer. Raw beef marinated in the perfect sauce with shallots and onions on the plate. SOOO DELICIOUS. 

My viet friends tell me this is a great dish people like to drink with. At My Canh, we seriously order multiple plates of this when we have big parties that come late night because it's so good. They also have pho and crab noodle soup which my friend swears by that they make the best one here. I had it, but it tasted pretty bland, with udon and crab in a thick broth. If you do like that stuff though, you can order the crab and ask that they take it out of the shell for you. That way, it's easier to eat. 

This is a great late night place. Cash only, divey, and close to bars. No other place compares to their beef carpaccio! If you do know a place, let me know so I can try it! =)
author: Joanna S.

description:
Felt like a mini-trip back to Hanoi.  No English the entire time we were in there, which is a blessing in a sea of pseudo-"authentic" Asian restaurants.  I can only speak for the Bun Bo, and it was stellar - smoky grilled pork and shrimp, great citrus/fish sauce and al dente noodles (though I did miss the fried garlic). Absolutely the perfect meal post your 5 Manhattan cocktails night (not that I did that at all).  Chilies in oil is not a pre-requisite, but love when that's on the table for the perfect condiment.

Gratis black tea is brought out the table within a minute after you sit down, rounding out the experience.

FYI - cash only, but that shouldn't be a problem even for us not-too-successful folks, as the most experience meal I saw was $8.50 and could easily feed 2.


Check out this fine place just before heading out of Chinatown into North Beach.
author: Maureen C.

description: Cheap, fast, and tastes decent. Service is kind of weird some times. The last time we were here they ran out of meat for one of the entrees we ordered and was going to tell us we couldn't have it without the meat. After some confusion, they made it for us anyways and I just gave my friend some of my meat. It's kind of an old and somewhat dirty spot, but if you want cheap and fast. Come hither.
author: Rebecca J.

description: Great place to grab late night pho and Vietnamese carpaccio (raw beef). The raw beef is about $15-20 for an appetizer while everything else is reasonably priced cheaper than that appetizer.
author: Pudgy G.

description:
The banh canh cua  or crab noodle soup is really something different and is a must try! Growing up in a Vietnamese/Chinese household, this is really one of the best dishes I've tried. It's a thick-soup with crab and pigs blood (which I love with a passion...but you can ask to take it out if it sounds nasty :D). The reason as to why I give it three stars is because of the cleanliness and oh ma gosh, it is pretty dirty here. But, it's in Chinatown, what am I really expecting? But also because of the service and lack of communication with the waiters is why I'm knocking down two stars. But if I had to eat in Chinatown, this would be one of my go-to spots, just because it's pretty delicious.

P.S, the price for this dish is seasonal, but from my experience it's usually around 8$-10$. not bad for a big bowl of crab noodles. :)
author: Mel T.

description:
I love the banh canh cua (crab noodle soup). Thats basically the only thing I've had here. Make sure to get it without bones. It gets annoying having to spit out tiny bits of crab shell. There's something in the broth that just warms your heart and soul on a cold day.

Customer service is lacking.. kinda what you would expect from an authentic asian restaurant. 
Anyways, I will return. I've always passed this restaurant when I was younger and never thought anything of it... Now its like comfort food when I come home from a long vacation. 

Crab noodle soup is a must try!
author: Ames A.

description: This place is literally a hole in the wall and how sanitary the restaurant is can be questionable. However, my friends and I keep coming back for our two favorite dish - bo tai chanh and banh canh cua. I don't know about you, but I always ask for my crabs to be already peeled. I don't like to stick my fingers into my soup to peel the crab. Bo tai chanh & banh canh cua is always a must for me after a night out in SF. Both are delish!
author: Wendy P.

description:
Been here a few times. Only ate the banh canh cua. Crab meat, slices of pork, shrimp and fried shallots on top. Semi thick broth. I think the noodle is made from scratch. It definitely don't taste like processed packaged noodles which taste like plastic. That's how the broth gets thick. The tapioca flower from the noodles. (I used to make this from scratch). Best. 
   
   Small joint about 6 to 7 tables. Kinda dirty looking and ghetto. Nothing fancy so don't expect a fancy restaurant. It's a hole in the wall. But the banh canh cua is one of best I've tried in restaurants. 

   Kinda pricey. It says by season for the banh canh cua. Our bowls came out to $12 a bowl and it seems to have been skimped on the food and noodles a bit.

    And ohh bring cash. Of course. Asian spots. There is a Wells Fargo diagonal to the restaurant.
author: Tony C.

description:
Worst place I've ever been I walked thru the door and the old Asian lady looked at me from head to toe (weird thing is that I was in a suit) looked upset we walked over to a table and sat down the lady looked at us and frowned grabbed two menus came to our table and threw two menus that landed on my girlfriends face and walked away,
We looked at each other in surprise and looked at her she looked back at us and mugged the shit out of us and walked to the kitchen we got up and walked out and ate at the Chinese restaurant 2 doors down.
I swear these people have the worst customer service they make u feel so uncomfortable and their kitchen is dirty as hell u see roaches running around u can only imagine what can be put in your food specially the way they act like they don't want your business.
I assumed they would want customers to come in and boost revenue but it seems it's the total opposite, to say the least I will never ever in my life visit this place again I rather starve than spend my hard earned money with these rude ass unwelcoming people.
Stay away from this shit hole on the wall.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
I love the banh canh cua, but honestly, I have nothing to compare it to.  It was my first time trying that type of noodle soup.  But, I do eat a lot of noodle soups and this was defiantly one of the tastier ones!  When you first get the soup its kind of slimy, but then it thins out as eat it.  The noodles are udon.  I recently learned that you can ask them for just meat and they de-shell most of it for you.  I'm really surprised that they give you this much crab meat in the soup.  

The restaurant in itself is dirty.  Its basic fold up tables inside a hole in the wall restaurant.  I think this place opens up late at night.  This might be the reason why its so dirty.  That and probably because it close to the strip clubs.
author: Lynn L.

description:
Thanks for the round of 'TUDE! *sarcasm*

On Saturday, 4.2.11 after partying at Bubble Lounge, my friends and I came to My Cahn by default since Vietnam Restaurant next door had a line out the door. We arrived a little before 2 AM and snagged the last available table in the back. (Closes at 3 AM on weekends.)

This was my first time at My Cahn and I know they're known for their Bo Tai Chanh (Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio) and Banh Canh Cua (Vietnamese Crab Soup w/ Udon Noodles). However, I had to settle with a rice dish because I was a bit nauseous to want to try the BTC and wouldn't be able to handle the MSG in the BCC. Even though I didn't order their signature dishes, the food at My Cahn is mediocre at best and the bulk of its business is from satiating the appetites of the drunken North Beach party goers. 

My friends and I started with the Cha Gio - Vietnamese Spring Rolls which were good. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZBX6HhQWZse0KJ_wPtIFAw?select=gpQprSUnuyzuPE8SIMae3g

The spring rolls were crunchy crust with a flaky cracker-like crust. It was generously filled with a pork and taro mixture that was savory. Parts of the spring roll were burnt, so it did leave a lingering charcoal-like flavor in my mouth. 

I ordered the Com Bi Thit Nuong - BBQ Pork Over Rice w/ Shredded Pork Skin. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZBX6HhQWZse0KJ_wPtIFAw?select=chie-P81M5HpIG0vf1cahA
 
In order to enjoy the dish, I think I would have to been completely drunk. The beef was chewy and bland. Other then the grill marks that added a smoky flavor, it was oily and tasteless. The pork skin & meat was missing that gelatinous and grainy texture and I literally had to bathe the meats in the nuoc cham (Vietnamese Chili Garlic Fish Sauce) to give it some moistness and flavor. Also, the rice didn't taste fresh; it was dry and hard. 

Inattentive service is a given for most Asian hole-in-the-places, but our waiter had a stick implanted so far up into his a$$ that it gave him a permanent sour face. The constant eye rolling and disinterest in being there created a very cold and uninviting environment. My Cahn ain't no Gary Danko, but the very least you can do is to acknowledge your customers' presence.

Oh yah, apparently I missed the memo on the NEWEST restaurant trend...serving water/tea at the END of the meal.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Cheap and open late. Someone in my group said that they reused bean sprouts from a previous table on our order -- I dunno how legitimate that is but the food tasted fine and I'm willing to give it another shot.
author: Zhi L.

description: Thumbs up. This place is light weight broke down if they just cleaned up a little bit they probably would attract more customers. Unfortunately, rent is probably sky high up here being that it's a few blocks off the main strip of Broadway. I've been here several times. BBQ pork over rice is always good. There Pho soup is delicious as well. Definitely a whole in the wall and a place to hit up after a few drinks.
author: Brian B.

description: No complaints. Cheap good pho late at night.
author: Annie L.

description:
Late night post partying munchies? This is your spot. Located by the intersection of Broadway and Columbus, there's usually a good amount of parking..even if you come when everyone gets kicked out if the clubs. Luckily we beat the food rush and got the last big table. The lady speaks Canto, Viet and English and gave us plenty of time to order. 

*Bo Tai Chanh. aka Raw Beef Salad. Mhh this is one of the best places I've had this in the area. 
*Pho Tai Sach! except there wasn't that much Tripe. 
*Grilled Chicken over Rice. Seafood over Rice. And a Vermicelli Bowl please. All good and very filling. The only complaint was that the chicken was more charred than grilled. 

fast service. open late. good food.
coming back unless there's a huge line (:

- jenn
author: Jenn Y.

description:
Hole in the wall in Chinatown. This place looks old and in a way looks like a storage room but the food there is really good. I've been here a few times when I was kid and have forgotten about it for years until my brother suggested we give this place another try. 

Now that I am no longer a kid, and can appreciate food more, I really like this place. The BBq pork over rice with egg was so good that it satisfied all craving that day. My brother for the bun bu hue and rare beef salad and both were delicious according to him.
author: Tiffany C.

description: The best banh canh cua i have ever had! I was so enjoyed it. It tastes like vietnamese traditional . 13$ a bowl -little bit more expensive but it worth it! Only one complain that people work here talk too much, too lound, too noisy and this place is very dirty, old place and smell bad! Only banh canh cua is good ! Everything else just ok!
author: Victoria N.

description:
Only come here when intoxicated - sorry to say.

Service here is sub-par and quite rude unfortunately.

Manager of the restaurant moved me and my friends to another
table without any legitimate purpose - that was rude.

We asked for waters for a table of 7 and we only received 3.

Food is mediocre but you can't really complain at 2:30 in the morning.
author: Sam K.

description: In love with their Banh Canh Cua (the only thing I order from there) and it's even better if you go to Cafe Broadway, just a couple of stores up, and get some Chinese donuts to go with it. Bomb dot com. The ladies there are really nice, they always know their regulars. The place is a small and a little dirty, but that's what comes with bomb lowkey Asian spots.
author: Lina N.

description:
Authentic style Vietnamese restaurant. Every type is covered and you won't be disappointed. We had Ba Canh Cua And Pho Tai. Honestly, there really isnt anything more to say. 
It is open until 2am, so even if it is your place to go after a night out, or your lunch or dinner option, it is a must.
author: Justin W.

description:
Since our first choice (Brenda's) had a ridiculous wait, we sadly defaulted to this hole in the wall joint. 

Food came out extremely fast, as all vietnamese restaurants do. The pho was good, but I still felt like it wasn't as good as home. In addition, we ordered the cha gio (egg rolls). I really disliked it. TOO MUCH TARO! Really not good, in my opinion. 

Maybe my standards are too high for a decent restaurant, but I already knew once I entered the restaurant that it wouldn't be a pleasant experience. Just felt dirty. 

Anyways, give it a try! I did, but won't be returning soon.
author: Jocelyn V.

description: Crusty little hole in the wall with all of my favorite Vietnamese bites. Also, their pho is piping hot- which I absolutely love because I take my rare steak on the side and dip it in the broth to gently poach. I'm almost always drunk when I'm here, so that might also account for the 5 stars. Fast no frills service, great prices, my wife and I were the only people in there speaking English (good sign), and they are open pretty much 24 hours woot!
author: Toa T.

description:
The owners here are very nice.  I think there are several of them who owns it.  They all talk to me whenever I come by to eat.  

This place serves a very mean crab soup.  I order it all the time without the shells because it's a lot easier to eat.  Their PHO here is good too.  

Service is very fast especially after 2AM on Fridays and Saturdays when the bars closes.  This place gets packed so you may have to wait during that time.  I recommend groups of four or larger.  You might get seated faster.

They also serve a large selection of Chinese food and their wet chow mein is pretty good with large servings.  Many local Chinese merchants frequents this place for a quick bite before heading home after a long days at work.  It's convenient and price is right.  

What's new on the their menu is their Korean BBQ for under $8.   They give you a good serving and it taste good.  

They have recently redecorated I noticed, and I think it looks great.

The atmosphere is nothing to brag home about.  It's a hole in the wall with home style cooking.  Service at least for me have always been great.  But then again I have been eating here for awhile, and now that I have recently joined YELP, I can finally share my review.
author: Nate L.

description:
This place is great for weekend late night munchies after a night out of drinking with friends. Its open until 4am and is usually packed right at 2am when all the local bars and clubs close. 

My favorite:

1. Bo Tai Chanh: raw beef salad. Its definitely one of the best I've had.

2. Bun Canh Cua: crab noodle soup. its very flavorful and definitely great since its cold at like 2am and tastes even better when you had a few drinks already

3. Bun Cha: cold vermecelli with meat and eggrolls. 

Theres only one bathroom and everyone seems to want to use it after the club so dont be surprised if you're stuck waiting.

TIP: try to arrive with your group before 2am. After 2am theres always a wait and you don't want to be staring down those who got a seat before you.
author: Joanne K.

description:
Cannot get enuf of Vietnamese food...ever. Absolutely a wonderful amalgamation of play in the mouth, with the freshest of ingredients.

Stopped by for a plate of satisfying grilled pork chop with shredded pork skin (a dehydrated version of Asian jerky) sprinkled atop the fragrant rice. And that bowl of wonder....that fish saucy, sugary, vinegar sauce with shredded carrots and green onions.

Cash only.

PS most recently made it in SF mag's best bowl of noodles for its pho.
author: Jana C.

description:
Purely based on the bún riêu I had today because Vietnam Restaurant next door was packed (at 3:30 pm! hipsters taking over my Vietnamese go-to place. *GRUMBLE).

Very tasty and solidly filling. Big chunks of tomato, fluffy crab/shrimp cakes, fried tofu, and little slabs of pork blood. With a drizzle of chili oil, this was perfect. 

So I need to go back to confirm, but this might be a better place for broth and soup noodles, and Vietnam Restaurant might be better for all the grilled meat/rice dishes.
author: Kevin L.

description:
BO TAI CHANH BO TAI CHANH BO TAI CHANH **chanting**  That's what's going through my head this morning...

Last night a friend Dung N. recommended this spot for some late night eats.  We, a party of 9, arrived around 10:30 to a small, literally "hole in the wall" restaurant, that was accompanied by a few patrons. Don't let the look fool you, go on in, order the Bo Tai Chanh (beef carpaccio) and enjoy, I promise you will not regret it. We sure didn't, and the waiter knew it too, we ended up getting 6 plates of that, as well as their famous Banh Canh Cua. 

Their Banh Canh Cua is good and you should definitely get a bowl, but I'm sorry, the Bo Tai Chanh dish was the star of the night. It's juicy, tender, slim raw beef slices with both onions and fried onions, basil, mint leaves, peanuts, and cooked in lots and lots of lemon juice, literally melts in your mouth to perfection. I'm drooling while typing this now.  I don't care how much other Yelpers complain about the price, we didn't even bother looking, as it was THAT good! 

The service was amazing, we had 1 waiter the whole time who reminds me so much of my late father.  He was fast, efficient, friendly, funny, cracked jokes with us.... c'mon, that's A++ service! 

Thumbs up for this spot!
author: Molly M.

description:
Late night pho? YES please!

Recently came here with a Vietnamese friend, and had a completely different and enhanced experience. I usually get the pho, but if you don't want to order your usual pho... try their crab soup (Banh Canh Cua). It contains thick noodles, crab, dried shrimp, pork blood, pork loin and lots of parsley. Though the soup contains a lot of things I don't normally eat, I enjoyed trying something new!

Also, their Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio (Bo Tai Chanh) is delicious!

Quick Tip:
- Cash Only
- Opened till 2AM
author: Jennifer L.

description:
We probably came on a bad day, but our experience here didn't excite us at all and in many ways discouraged us to ever come back. 

Let's start with atmosphere. It was not that great. It was kind of cluttered since they seem to be running out of space to put all their store needs away. So we can see the stacks of sack of rice oh and a sack of Monosodium Glutamanate (MSG!!!). Now I"m not doubting that most Asian restaurants don't use MSG, but don't make it so obvious. To be fair most people I know who stay away from MSG still don't know what it stands for and the bag did have it all written out. 

Then there was one worker just sitting at the table doing her thing like cutting vegetable because there must not be enough room in the back. Normally I don't mind it because that just means they can keep an eye on you and make sure you are taken care of while still getting important stuff outta the way. Only problem was, she wasn't keeping an eye on us so the service wasn't good and it was a little awkward watching someone cutting veggies haha. 

Again we came in an awkward hour so there was hardly anyone there, but still no reason for the service to be bad. I take it that this place is more catered to folks with the late night munchies because I"m sure it will satisfy their needs and they are probably at a state where they won't realize that the ambiance is lacking. Since we came in a weird hour, we too, weren't so hungry so my friend just ordered a soda and the other some won tons.... 

About the won ton...they were not good. There wasn't much substance in it as compared to normal ones, but a whole lot of the wrapper I guess... 

Overall I bet it could be great coming in at a different hour, but considering the food and the service wasn't so good, we don't really have a reason to come back unless we accidentally stumble into here during the late night hours.
author: Magicka M.

description: Open late very yummy pho tai and fast service. A little pricey for soup but big quantity.
author: Talia S.

description:
For a mom and pop shop serving comfort food at 1am when you're drunk.. this place is perfect! However, i think they have raised their prices recently. I was just there this past weekend and we got two bowls of their crab udon and a plate of the rare steak and it came out to $50! wtheck?! lol.. Oh well..

I think its only good when you're drunk, otherwise, i'm sure you can find better.

The service is your typical asian restuarant and so is the atmosphere.. probably not the cleanliest places, but hey.. the food is decent.. haha!
author: Jenn L.

description: Amazing food. Crab Pho is so good that my fiancé had it and insisted he take me back the next day so I could try it. Also loved the carpaccio, Vietnamese coffee, and fresh coconut. It's a hole-in-the-wall spot so don't expect anything even remotely fancy. Just be ready to eat.
author: Jessica V.

description:
My hubby and I have been dined here about 2 years. It was 4 stars for me, but today the catfish clay pot was not fresh as usual. Especially the rice was too dry, my hubby even can't really eat it. So, I gave him my crab meat tomato rice noodle instead. Usually I really like it, especially in the cold night. Today is just okay for me.
 
Service is 3 stars as well. The lady( I guess she is the owner) always provides very good service to us, but the guy has never smile to customers at all. Unfortunately, he was our server tonight....:( 

Still will come back since I really like to have a hot noodle soup at the cold night, and they are opened late.....:)
author: Chanel P.

description: I've eaten here at least over 30 times in my life without incident (and without hesitation) and loved their food but last Wednesday will be my last. I'm asian, have traveled all over the world w/o an incident of food poisoning and have an iron stomach but whatever it was must have been some pretty nasty bacteria I ingested from this restaurant's Vietnamese Crab Noodle Soup (which is a dish they are known for). In fact, I lost 7 pounds in 36 hours b/c I couldn't keep anything in my body for more than 10 minutes and had to be next to a restroom at all times. If the food was safe, I would recommend but given this unfortunate experience of mine, I can only forewarn others to eat at their own risk here.
author: Benny M.

description:
Their banh canh cua=tapioca flour udon noodle w/crab meat soup is thick because of the type of flour noodle used. It was also salty because of the crab paste. The dish is an acquired taste if you're not used to it. I suggest adding copious amounts of chili pepper and lemon to offset the saltiness.

This spot also carry other popular items (e.g., the pho was so-so, the bun rieu is much better, the rice plates were so-so, etc.). They have coconut water in coconut shell or in a can. And, I always try to grab a red-bean in coconut milk dessert drink to-go.

Pay them a visit not because of high quality VNese foods (2-star food if daytime, 3-star food if late at night), but because they open late-nights, and can fit a group in.

The place seems unkempt but that's an atmosphere requirement for late-nights grub.
author: Peter L.

description:
As with most things on this stretch of Broadway, its a late night spot.  When you have partied until they don't let you party no more and now you think you need to get food to keep the night going, My Canh is a good choice.  Its Vietnamese food, so you can't really go too wrong.  

Their Crab Udon Noodle Soup is what they are known for.  The soup is hearty and flavorful with whole crabs put in there.  You can also requests that they give you crab without the shell.  For this soup alone, I would give them four stars.  And although not on the menu, their Beef Capaccio with fried shallots is also deserving of 4 stars.

The highlights end there.  The place can get crowded in the after hours, and it's very hole in the wall (not clean).  The rest of the menu is sub-par to okay.  You can get much better pho in other places, maybe not at that hour tho.  

Try to beat the rush if you can, or else its not worth waiting around for.
author: Veasna H.

description: Love this spot! The people here are always super friendly (except one guy who has no emotion whatsoever) and always remembers my order. I go here quite often for the bun bo hue, shrimp bun and shrimp spring rolls. It's very spacious for big groups - I've brought 12 people here at once and they are very accommodating! Also great for their fresh coconuts which is perfect for the next day hangovers! I'm going to be so sad when I move out of my apartment and away from this friendly neighborhood spot!
author: Portia G.

description: I've been coming to this restaurant for the past 20 years since I was in high school. I usually ordered duck noodles soup all the time. It's very disappointed when I order the same dish and all they gave me is a left over meats that is about to throw out in the garbage. I will never ever go back to this damn place again. Take a look at the photo I took earlier
author: Jessica T.

description: FCK THIS PLACE. So me and my friends came to eat late night pho after a couple drinks at the bar and two of them decided not to order anything out of the 6 of us. Once I told the lady that her expression went from normal to pissed off. This changed our mood from 100 to 0 real quick. I'm sorry lady that some of us didn't want to eat but seriously? I'd understand if there was a hella long line but there was like NO ONE WAITING. Why you so mad bro? Also when one of my friends ordered the wontons the other server lady was like "NO WONTON. YOU GET EGGROLL OK?" I'm like wow rude excuse me i know you hate you're job but it doesn't mean you should take it out on the customer. The food was decent but my friend wanted extra limes but she was too scared to ask because that lady looked like she was going to chew our heads off. We gave her a 1 dollar tip because shit man you don't treat people that way. HOW YOU GONNA SERVE US ALL ANGRY AND EXPECT TIP? NO NO TIP FOR YOU LADY NO TIP FOR YOU.
author: Jane K.

description: Yummy and great Asian experience. It isn't as clean as we would have hoped. Delicious pho though and yummy hot tea!!
author: K D.

description:
Can't hate on this place even though it is pretty hole in the wall.  But this place is a true hidden gem.

I love coming here at all times of the day.  I usually just get the Crab noodle soup and bo tai chanh and it happens to be the most popular dishes

I recommend this place for anyone who wants to try some bomb ass soup!

It even made it on my list of things to do in san francisco which you can check out here.

http://www.thealldayblog.com/the-choose-your-own-adventure-1-day-all-day-trip-guide-to-san-francisco/

If you're a tourist and want to try something out of your comfort zone!  COME HERE!
author: Michael L.

description: (Two teenagers) I went with my friend here for dinner. We got there and it seemed pretty packed, but we got seated pretty quickly. They served us tea and walked away. We were waiting for the menu, but nothing, and even made eye contact with the waitress. I tried to ask the waitress for the menu, but they just ignored you and focused on other customers. (Was it because we're teenagers and that they think we don't get treated professionally like other adauts?!?! Agism is still going around?) It's reasonable if we didn't get our menu for the first 5-10 minutes because it was quite busy. But we didn't get a menu until half an hour later. The food was okay, taster like any other Vietnamese restaurant. The only thing bad here was the customer service.
author: Alice H.

description: In desperation for late night good we came here to fill our hungry stomachs. Service is horrible. Even for late night standards it's really bad. Food is good hence the 2 stars but be prepared to be treated like s**t. Zero acknowledgement, you have you also multiple times for anything including someone taking your order.  Bottom line if you're hungry and it's late night, don't come here as you will end up waiting forever!
author: Trinity K.

description:
Banh Canh Cua is all right here. Nothing special in my opinion only because I've had a lot better.

The broth is a bit oily and a little thick.There was a distinct flavor missing from the broth and I'm not sure what it is. The crab was sauteed and then placed on top of the banh canh. The sauteed crab had plenty of flavor and it was very good. But I think the flavor should be in the broth too!
author: Angela C.

description: Good food here is bánh canh cua and bò tái chanh...its expensive but its so yummy haha best spot for late dinner after clubbing in sf ...kaka...
author: Tan H.

description:
I came back here for the second time for another Banh Canh Cua; I love it. 
I and my boyfriend took his family here with us.  
we got spoiled with good food at home so it's not easy to satisfy everyone but we all left happily. Everything was good and quick. 
The restroom was little small and people worked there were having their own conversation quite loud. 
I will definitely come back again when I visit San Francisco.
author: Sindy N.

description:
After hearing so much about this place, although I am from Norcal (Davis/Sac) I was more than anxious to try this place. Okay, let me warn you.. this place is seriously like a dump. I walked in thinking.."wth?! hm...am i at the wrong place?? THIS is the famous My Canh ?!?!" but dont be fool by its cover! Their Banh Canh is bomb dot com and i mean it!!! 

Being a huge Banh Canh lover, I KNOW what I want in my Banh Canh and this place is the only place that has suit me well :) all the way from Sac onto Oakland and now onto SF - I have never had a more satisfying bowl of Banh Canh -- well ofcourse I had better in San Jose and in LA (in Viet-towns) 

My friends and I also ordered the Jellyfish,shrimp and pork salad to share-- LOVED IT :) although the sauce could've been a little better. But I wont complain too much about that. 

But there is one thing that I just address, they do serve unfreshed, nasty bean spouts and lime... they should definitely keep those fresh since it is needed to compliment our dishes. 


Nonetheless, just get over the fact that this place will remind you of Vietnam, and enjoy the delicious food!
author: Tiffany T.

description: I came here pretty drunk, didn't know what to order or eat. Someone ordered me banh canh with crab and blood. I enjoyed it very much! Even though the soup was thick and jelly ish. I can say I will be coming back whenever I'm back in sf. Probably I should judge the food when I'm sober! And this place stayed open later which is nice.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Looks a lil dirty and ghetto outside/inside, but the food is to die for. Their banh canh cua is perfect, this place is perfect for after a night of clubbing since it's open super late. Service is good and food is delicious. Don't judge a book by its cover!
author: Connie H.

description:
GREAT for late nights. I think they are open until 4am on the weekends.

We had the crab noodle soup..yumm.
author: Tammy F.

description:
Bf had the combo pho and said it was best described as noodles in water. My bun ho hue was better than that but I wouldn't come back, it definitely could use more flavor.  I wasn't that shocked though, it's so hard to find good BBH in SF!

The waitstaff inexplicably started burning trash in a metal tin and placed it directly outside the front door. Surprise surprise, the smell of smoke makes its way in and customers start complaining about the smoke. I see passersby staring at the metal tin of fire. Nothing is done. Is this happening?  Yes, yes it is.  We went home and our hair and clothes reeked of smoke.
author: Erika C.

description:
why?

1. banh canh cua 5 stars the best in the city...
2. price affordable 5 stars
3. cleanliness 3 stars
4. cash only 3 stars 
5. even place is small every time we visited we always got seats 4 stars

so in average i gave it 4 stars and promise my next visit i'll try that yummy beef carpaccio..
author: Dedy G.

description:
Late review on dining experience. Came to taste the beef salad.

Pros:

Good beef salad, I've had better. But this one is good as well. Lettuce is cut too big, and lay out of salad could be more presentable.


Cons:

Cash only
Slow service- it wasn't busy in there either 
Place looks grimy
author: m l.

description: This is one of those place where you definitely shouldnt judge a book by its cover.  Sure, the place looks run down and is basically a shack in the wall, but its signature dishes will satisfy your hunger. Always order banh canh cua and bo tai chanh and enjoy your feast. Additionally, you can enjoy story time here if you're vietnamese ... Just open up your ears and listens to the cooks yell at each other.
author: Lam L.

description:
I TOTALLY WANT TO GIVE THIS PLACE A 5...just for one dish (2 really). 

Im going to cut straight to the chase, go here and order their freakin #21..that is all.  Its called Banh Canh Cua (crab noodle soup?) and its the best ive ever had it anywhere.  Ever. 

I mean, if you want to dock them on a lot of things, but every city has its gems...and this is truly one of those places you gotta try out if you are in the area.  Also, grab the Bo Tai Chanh (Raw beef or some crap...dont know what its called in English).  Its really good because the flavor is there...all 5 times that I visited the consistency is the same. 

Just remember to bring cash. I know man, it sucks but what can you do.  ITS WORTH IT!
author: Viet L.

description:
Had the Crab noodle soup. It was gloppy so prob had a lot of cornstarch in there. I liked the flavor tho even tho I had no clue what I'm really drinking and why it's orangey yellow?!  The only thing I didn't like was they gave my friend and I, 2 small pieces of crab. felt kinda gypped!! hopefully it was cuz the crabs were not in season yet? =( 
if i had more crab, i would call this a real deal @ $10.50! 
the other menu items were pretty cheap! $7 range. i'll try smtg else next time!
author: David C.

description: Banh Canh Cua!!! Sometimes they don't have it with the crab already broken up in the soup and they give you the cracked shelled crab, which I don't like as much. The soup is so delicious and you can opt to add the grilled shrimp on top, which is delicious! Every time I get a fresh young coconut to drink, it's on point! Love this place for late night noodle soup!
author: Katherine L.

description:
My sister said she comes here for the late night drunchies, next morning hangovers and just pho cravings. I came here on a random day with my boyfriend because I was craving bun bo hue.

Environment: Its a very cheap place but that didn't turn me off because I wanted the bun bo hue. FYI, the ladies working here can be quite loud so just prepare yourself when you eat here...

Food: I got the bun bo hue; pretty tasty and savory. I think they put more stuff in mine that other bun bo hues I had at other places ( like extra sprouts, leaves, meat, etc.) My boyfriend got a clear broth noodle soup that wasn't pho and it seemed like it tasted well too. The next time I come here, I will be coming for the actual pho.

VERDICT: Everything was quick and easy. We were in and out within 30 mins and two bowls of noodles came out to be around 16 bucks! Pretty good!
author: Eileen W.

description:
A good place to hit after a night of fun.. 
It gets super pack though so waiting for a table might take some time. 
Their food is ok.. 
We ordered their Bún Riêu: meat ball like soup with rice noodle
banh canh cua (crab soup with Li fun aka thick udon noodle) the crab was a bit salty and fishy taste because it wasn't in season yet..
author: Lor L.

description: The Korean beef short ribs with sunny side egg over rice is a BOMB!!! Restaurant opens till 3am to take care those alcoholic like me. Try the beef short ribs lever rice and we won't be wrong. Trust me!
author: Mandy W.

description:
Service is quite rude here, guess I should have read the reviews earlier. They didn't want to serve us water and kept telling us "Yes we get you water" but we didn't have water the entirety of our meal. 

My cousin ordered the crap noodle soup which was tasty, but had SO much corn starch in it that it was so viscous and almost like drinking goo. Definitely had some good crab in it though and you can ask for the crab to be shelled so you dont have to crack them open yourself.

I ordered the Bun Bo Hue, which lacked flavor. I had to put so much fish sauce in it to get the saltiness in there. Maybe this was an off day.
author: Cassie C.

description: bun bo hue and bun thit nuong are ok! but the service is pretty bad! the only reason I come to this restaurant bc they open really late at night...
author: Ann B.

description: Definitely had better pho. The noodles and meat were very bland.
author: Jessica K.

description:
This place is THE place to go for the post-2AM craving! They stay open as long as there are people here. I find myself eating here at 4am...definitely messed up my meal and sleep schedule but oh well! They got egg rolls, noodle soup, pho, rice plates! What I usually get here is #21 Banh Canh Cua (crab tapioca noodle soup). It's SOOOOO good and they don't usually serve this in any Vietnamese restaurant in the city. It comes with a thick soup base along with pork, pork blood and fried onion flakes. It really hits the spot after a night of drinking and it's close by if you went out for the nightlife in the North Beach/Chinatown area.

Don't expect too much of that exceptional service. They pretty much just serves you what you asked for. Quick, easy, and don't desire too much. You will be with a crowd of drunkies if you come late night; it's a given.

Cash only!!!! And watch out for 2am street cleaning on some streets if you drove.
author: Nancy N.

description:
If you happen to stumble upon My Canh on one of those late drunken nights, you MUST order the Banh Canh Cua--thick noodle crab soup.  Best comfort food ever to balance out all that alcohol in you. Plus it's  authentic and yummy!  Besides crab meat it also comes with a few cubes of pork blood!! 
I do wish the portions were bigger as I be craving for more after I finish my bowl! Or maybe I'm just a pig. 

Do request for no shells as it's a pain to try to work around it to get the crab meat out. Not the biz especially if you drunk. 

If you like raw beef salad, get this here too! Bomb!

Cash only of course. 

Omg I am craving a bowl of their crab noodle soup like right now. This sucks!
author: Cathy M.

description:
The first time I returned from traveling and working in Vietnam I came back to the States craving pho - which I had eaten for breakfast almost daily for a couple weeks.  With my clock being turned around I was wide awake and hungry around 1 AM.   Pho this late in SF?  I was happy to find My Canh - open late.  Perfecto.

Ever since that first night I have been here too many times to count.  And I've introduced it to many people.

Not being a fan of beef, I used to order pho ga (chicken noodle soup) and bun bo (five spice barbecue rice noodle).  And I'd seldom skip the shrimp fresh spring rolls.  Then I started eating here a lot with a vegetarian friend.  That's when I started ordering #93 (vegetarian soup) with thin rice noodles (it normally comes with wide rice noodles).  YUM!  Veggies and tofu goodness (thanks Chris!).  If you like spice (I can't get food spicy enough - so factor that into this statement) ask for the small red Vietnamese peppers - they really kick.

This place is consistent - and believe me I've collected the data to be able to say that : )  Indeed it's a hole in the wall - but have no doubt it is a serious contributor to San Francisco's wonderful culinary assortment.
author: Scott S.

description:
I have a new favorite Vietnamese place in San Francisco. Why you ask? It's because they offer high quality entrees for such a steal. My favorite is the steamed rice with grilled pork. The grilled pork has so much flavor in it, I literally think about it all day and all night. I would park in the red zones if I cannot find parking, run in and pick up my togo order and just eat it in the car. I literally don't waste time eating the meal.

Also, the meat is topped with the perfect amount of stir fried green onions and accompanied by cucumbers and lettuce. The fish sauce also has bits of cucumber and sliced carrots and it definitely is one of the better sauces I have had. I would drink that SOLO cup up but it's way better drizzled all over my rice and grilled pork. 

Great service as well at My Canh with the staff always making sure we have everything such as sauces, utensils or water. My biggest gripe though is definitely the parking. I never find parking and don't think I ever have but when I do, I do enjoy sitting down and eating here. I have had many times spent with my plastic togo box and my car.
author: Danster L.

description: Little hole in the wall. Doesn't seem like the cleanest place but we were told this is the place to be for late night dining in Chinatown. I ordered the duck Pho which wasn't very good and the broth tasted pretty bland. I didn't try anything else but based on the quality of my pho I will not be coming back.
author: Jimmy W.

description: I usually like to eat here and order the crab noodle soup because they stay consistent. Tonight was the most disappointing experience ever so I had so I have to write a review. The crab was stale and old with no flavor. It's like eating dry squid. The noodles were way too soft. Was asked for extra noodle and there was way more soup than anything else. When I asked the waiter if there was added noodles she said yeah. I just didn't want to be difficult and under minded it. And then they over charged me for the meal. Like seriously.... I don't mind paying extra but they really try to rip me off and it's obvious. I have ordered this so many times so I already know how it's supposed to be . I'm not gonna order the crab noodle soup again until they get their shit together. What did I do to deserve this horrible meal?
author: A A.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night after hitting the dance floor with a girlfriend and just beat the rush by a few minutes.  The line was out the door!

I can't remember exactly what I ordered...the lemongrass chicken or the five spice chicken, but I remember loving it and finishing it.  Got it with fried egg on top.  I love when the yolk breaks and runs down into my rice.  Yum!  Just what I needed after a night out.  :)
author: Jenny L.

description:
It felt like home away from home being in a dingy little restaurant with too many tables that its square footage could accommodate.  The servers were hustling and bustling, even at 1am.  Amidst the drunk girls piling and their male counterparts howling nonsense, our large group of 10 managed to score two tables side by side.

Their prized banh canh cua was the the coveted item of the night.  A round for our table, please, and 1 order of hu tieu kho dac diet for our non-crustacean eating friend.  It took about 20 minutes for our orders to be taken.  This is a long time for an American establishment's standards.  For a Vietnamese restaurant?  It felt like an eternity!  Little did we know the food itself would take over 20 minutes to come out, too!  If their reputation did not precede them, I may have walked out.

I'm glad I stayed.

The banh canh cua was absolutely satisfying.  The broth was thick, almost like a syrup; the way it should be.  You should be able to see the viscosity of the broth when you drip it from your spoon.  This was a true banh canh.  You know what else is true?  The crab!  No fake imitation crab in my bowl.  That, my Yelpers, I can dig.

I also tried the hu tieu kho dac biet.  It was comparable to the better noodle places down in OC's Little Saigon.  Banh canh cua here takes the cake, though.  I would stop in, especially if the crab is in season.
author: Francine L.

description:
************************** 511 ***************************

            At 2 in the morning, when you have enough drinks for the night, My Canh is the place we come for some comfort noodle soup and yummy food.

- Banh Canh - Vietnamese thick clear noodle soup  with Dungeness crab, pork, onion, cilantro, serves with beansprout, lime, and chili - the best in town!

- Mi Kho - egg noodle dry with a bowl of soup serves on the side, pork, shrimp, and  much more love.

- Bo` Tai' Chanh - Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio with Lemon - so good here!

- Bun' Thit Nuong -  Vietnamese rice vermicelli mixed with fresh vegetables, mix sauce, and topped with grilled pork, peanuts.

- Cha~ Gio` -Vietnamese egg rolls - also very good here.

         If you don't mind the Asian crews (gangsta, OG and the-look-alike), it's a good place to come. Be aware that none of the chairs or tables are matching, but you will be lucky to score a table to sit down at the wee hours.

         Service is quick and efficient here. I love the people that work here, they are just nice folks staying up late to serve me the authentic food that I grow up with, always with smiles on their faces. 

         I've been a fan here for 5 years!
author: Manda Bear B.

description:
THIS 5 STAR RATING IS SOLELY FOR ITS BANH CANH. 
Besides from its shitty service and hole in the wall place where you find drunk people and lots of shouting. The banh canh is my favorite to end a wonderful night of walking around in the city. It totally warms the belly and it hits the spot. I love how they actually put crab legs in the soup because its soaks up the yummy soup and just makes the soup full of bursting crab flavor. 

Tip: Make sure you bring cash since they dont accept card and be ready to be assertive so you can flag your server down to get some damn service.lol
author: Amber H.

description:
Today is my first time here. The food and service is good, the staff members are very polite.

I ordered the number 43 which was grilled pork chop with a scrambled egg, lettuce and tomatoes over rice. The plate of food I ordered was very delicious. This is typically one dish you would see on the menus of some Vietnamese restaurants.

Wow, I've been going to New Sun Hong Kong Restaurant which was just a few doors down.  This restaurant is a bit larger than the Vietnam Restaurant next door, so it can sit about 15-20 people. Overall, I enjoyed my first time experience here at this restaurant so I'll definitely come here again.

Average tab per person: $5-$7

**Cash Only**

Parking: Street Parking

Craving for Vietnamese Cuisine? Come on in. My Canh is certainly an excellent restaurant for this.
author: Bennett W.

description: This place has great Vietnamese food! And open late too! They have the absolute best bun rieu (tomato crab vermicelli soup), which is very hard to find in most Vietnamese places. The tomato base is northern Vietnamese unlike the southern style most US places have.
author: Peter K.

description:
my go to. since before i moved to sf. 

it's consistent, cheap, and fresh. 

i know what i'm getting and it's not fussy. it's also authentic vietnamese. 

opens late +
author: Mimi C.

description:
Great option for late night drunk food!

I had the Crab Udon Noodle soup (request it without the shell, if you don't want to fight with your food).  Would definitely recommend! Just keep in mind that this place is typical of a Vietnamese hole-in-the-wall restaurant - dirty and sticky and crowded, but cheap and satisfying. 

I will most likely be back on my next late night venture out on Broadway.
author: Sally T.

description: Worst Pho I ever had but who I'm I to complain I keep coming back, but I guess it's a good spot to eat in the middle of the night when your drunk lolololol
author: Irene S.

description: If i could give zero stars I would. Had to ask for water at least 4 times before we got our glasses. They gave no bean sprouts with our pho. Also said they ran out of onions. Horrible service.
author: Jimmy N.

description:
Quite a few people raved about the banh canh cua here. It's decently good, but not the best. I'm still looking for the best! The soup base is thick and overall I don't think it's very flavorful. However, I appreciate that they crack the crab for you upon request and they give you a good amount of it, too. 

I come back to this place over and over again not for their banh canh but for their beef carpaccio (bo tai chanh). The best. A little expensive though but I'm sort of addicted now.
author: Van Anh D.

description:
Honestly this place is way to over hyped. Service stinks, place stinks, and food sucked.. the banh canh cau was alright. I've tasted better from places in San Jose. They give you such a small portion, we had only two pieces of crab parts in our soup. 

Our waitress was down right rude. I brought a water bottle in, and she clearly saw me take the water bottle out of my bag and still decided to charge me $2 for water. I had to tell her that I brought the water bottle in, and it wasnt even the same brand of water they sold. She had the nerve to say oh well you should have let me know that wasnt our water. Seriously? you work here shouldnt you know and asked? smh.

go elsewhere guys...
author: Vicky H.

description:
The Fantastic-4 had an early dinner after grocery-shopping in Chinatown. We wanted Chinese, but other restaurants along the strip of Broadway St. were crowded. There are two Vietnamese restaurants on this busy block of Broadway Street. We landed here, because we were the first people there.

We have been here many times. Matt had the popular XL Beef Noodle soup (#1). The claim to fame noodle soup, which cost $5.75 was decent; nothing too fancy. Wife had the Seafood Noodle soup (#5). Her $6.00 soup contained a variety of seafood in a noodle soup. The kids split an order of the Grilled Beef and Spring-Roll over cold Vermicelli Noodles. The $6.00 cold dish was enough for the two kids. 

Our satisfied meal came really fast and we finished within 30 minutes. It is good thing, because we don't want to stay any further at this dirty Vietnamese Restaurant in Chinatown.
author: Matt G.

description:
Came here after work with a friend. A hole in the wall describes this place well because it isn't a fancy restuarant. This place gets packed during weekends because the surrounding area are clubs and they open till 2am. Not many restaurant in china-town opens as late as they do and many of china-town only accepts cash like this place. The prices for the main courses were cheap but i ididnt go for the 2 pieces of spring/summer rolls...$5.45. My friend this was the only place she found that uses udon noodles on some of the options. The funny thing was the waitress here don't speak english well or dont speak at all... You need a chinese/vietnamese person with you when you order or you can just point at the order/ say the number, LOL.

I ordered #27 and my friend ordered #20. Good stuff. I was reading on other yelpers review on how their bean sprouts, etc... werent fresh, but mine came out fine. Both of us finished our food and left satisfied, definitely coming back here again.
author: Jade L.

description:
"Yelp says I'm a regular here!"

I love this place. A true hole-in-the-wall but a total hidden gem. I stop by whenever I'm in the city. The "Bo Tai Chanh" (Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio) is easily the best around. We order it every single time. It's a must! Oh, and of course...we have to get the infamous "Banh Canh Cua". The broth is on the thicker side when it comes to noodle soups, but it is very flavorful and just plain good for the tummy! It comes with slices of pork and pieces of crab. Remember to ask them to take the shells off the crab for you.

 *Mmm mMm goOod!*
author: Dung N.

description:
Hole in the wall?  Check.  Open after clubbing?  Check.  Beef carpaccio?  Check.  Yeahhhhhhhhh.  This place serves up a mean noodle soup, and we ordered a ton of different items from the menu and they were all dankity dank.  On the real, I would highly recommend the crab noodle soup and the beef carpaccio.  

PROTIP:  Gets poppin' on weekends after the clubs in the area close down so you might have to stand in line.
author: David C.

description:
I have this condition called I'm-Not-Hungry-But-Can-And-Will-Still-Eat-A-Large-Meal.  If I didn't exercise, this condition would probably lead me to another condition called Obesity.

I'd been eating all morning (literally half a box of Corn Pops, two types of dim sum snacks, Japanese rice crackers, Wasabi peas, Oreos, and candy), and at 11:30 Boyfriend IMed me at work and asked if I wanted to join him and his coworkers for lunch in Chinatown.  Do I ever pass up a meal?  No.

So my coworker C and I headed to meet them at My Canh, a place that I'd always passed but never had the chance to actually sit and eat there.  At a little before noon, there were still open tables, but as we finished around 12:30, the place was mostly filled (it's really small).

Large, extensive menu included different types of pho, rice dishes, vermicelli bowls, and vegetarian options.  Coworker had the #25 pho tai, Boyfriend had #43 Pork and Pork Skin with Egg over Rice, and in my attempt to be healthy, I had the sauteed tofu with broccoli over rice.

Pretty big portions, good flavors, cheap food at around $7/person.  CCG was happy about it, and CCG was more than amused by the very irritated-looking server.  The funny thing is, I'd just finished jokingly telling Steven T. that in the Chinese language, the word "service" does not exist.  Apparently it doesn't exist in the Vietnamese language as well.

Oh, as expected, cash only.  Whomp whomp.
author: Tori S.

description:
quick tip: CASH ONLY! Place gets pretty packed and its a really small restaurant 

Whats great about this place is they open late, after a night of clubbing, i can walk to china town and get me a good bowl of banh canh to sober me up. generous chucks of crab, broth is tick and flavorful, good amount of noddles. Plus its cheap what more can i ask for
author: James L.

description: This is my last stop before heading home.  Always pack with late night crawlers.  I ask for extra spicy on my crab noodle. The waiter look at me and point to the hot sauce.  Lol thats what i get for asking huh? lol oh well next time
author: Linda B.

description:
It's been four months since I've been here. I came here after a solo trip to the city specifically to have the banh canh cua because I always heard great things about it. 

I was hesitant to come in because the place was dead (I did come during off hours) and everyone working there seemed to be chillin' in the dining area. After debating about it for like five minutes, I came in, sat, and ordered. I asked if they could shell the crab for me. I was told they don't do it, which already made me want to leave because that would mean not only would I get really messy, I'd probably lose out on a lot since I have braces. Even so, I toughed it out.

I don't know what people are talking about. I have to admit i was really excited to try it and the soup looked great, but it was definitely lacking in flavor. I was extremely disappointed, and remember eating my food unhappily with a lot of the chili sauce. I didn't finish it, either.
author: Nga C.

description:
I have come here a few times after the bars or clubs for a quick bite. The most recent time I went, I got beef stew... The beef was not good. The soup was fine. There's a lot of drunk people late at night but at least they were still open. Service is whatever but it's super cheap. I guess it's okay for that. I personally wouldn't really choose to come here but my friends were down so I just came with them... 

BRING CASH!!!
author: Connie Y.

description: I absolutely love this place my fiancé brings me here after a long day work I love the noodle pork dish #38 fried spring rolls are the best.
author: Remysbarbie M.

description:
FORGET THE SERVICE. ITS ALL ABOUT THE FOOD!

this is the one time I dont care about service: when i'm highly entoxicated! HOLLA

came by after a night out with my buddy yelper Jennifer T. a few weeks ago and i was like damn, I BEEN HERE WHEN I WAS A KID! 

Now i remember why I use to come here, because their food is BOMB DOT COM!

I ordered: special house crab noodle soup
Jennifer T ordered: Bun Bo Hue (of course her clueless self would add too much hot sauce btw)


I can understand in their point of view to why their service is bad. C'mon, they're dealing with drunk and intoxicated customers (like myself) at 2am in the morning when they could easily be sleeping! I'd be just as irritated as they were. Oh yeah, that's also because there was some idiot flashing his butt cheeks while everyone was trying to eat. No one cares, BRO. 

anyways. I NEED TO COME BACK. I WANT THAT CRAB SOUPAA
author: Kenny L.

description: Total rip off! First off, the food is alright. Thinking under $10 a bowl is pretty good.., Theres prices on the menu, everything is $7 - $8...., they gave us the bill and it was $66.00 for 4 bowls of food! Are you seriously? Totally rip us off!!!!
author: Nhi H.

description:
(See pics)

Late night after food and drinks and needed more food to absorb the drinks. Finding food, something good, something on the oily filling side, something comfort, something that was still open (right around 2am and they were nice to serve us.)

Peter L took us here. Really delicious eggrolls. I tried a few new things too! Vietnamese crepe with sprout was so very good. The spicy noodle soup was bright happy yellow spicy!

I wish it's closer to my hood!
author: T L.

description: I finally went to this restaurant after reading reviews and also it's close to my house, so I gave it a try. I went during late afternoon maybe 3 or 4ish and it wasnt busy at all (but I've walked by it around like 1/2am and it's hella busy) . I ordered Bun Bo Hue, and mmmm mmmm it was good! They give you options on how spicy you want it (I like mine pretty spicy). When it came out it tasted great and has a bunch of meat in it! (All the traditional types too, not just beef) also, they give you a nice serving. All the staff are really nice and can't wait to go back a bunch of times.
author: Samantha R.

description:
This spot satisfies our weekly pervy outlashes: "HAY LET'S GO MY C*NT!"  or "HAY WANNA EAT MY C*NT?"

I'll keep this short and sweet: 

1. Banh Canh Cua
2. Raw Beef Salad
3. mMmMmM
author: Eda L.

description: I like coming here for the crab bahn Cahn and the Bo tai chanh. The crab is just savory enough and I like that they are open late. The place is a little small so can only accommodate so many.
author: Kam P.

description:
I come here a lot after clubbing/bar hopping in SF. Every time I get the Banh Canh Cua (Crab) and Bo Tai Chanh (raw beef). The noodles are thick at first but the more you eat it, the thinner it gets. They kinda jip you on the crab meat and give you like one piece of pork. They used to take off the shell for you before too, but now I don't think they want to at 4am for some drunk-tards having crazy drunchies. STILL, I love love LOVE. 

*CASH ONLY*
author: Bi L.

description:
On a cold Friday night, my husband and I came out the front door of the SW Hotel and looked for a place to eat dinner.  We walked up and down Broadway a few times, looking at the Canto spots and the Viet spots, but I wasn't in the mood for Canto flavors and I was little unsure about the homeless man in front of one Viet place and the near-zilch seating in the other Viet place. Finally, we came into My Canh and sat ourselves in the back by the drinks fridge and hoped for the best.  

Let's just say that the whole experience reminded me of the joy being a teenager in NYC Chinatown in the 1990s.  Beautiful Viet-American girls with bleached hair and cute makeup weaved in and out of English and Vietnamese as they talked about everything from hair to boys, while chowing down.  And old dude in the corner slurped up his noodle soup just as it was his right to enjoy every morsel.  And then there was us, me with a chip on my shoulder of bygone NYC Chinatown and my husband who doesn't even really like Viet food.  Well suffice to say -- THANK YOU MY CANH for serving up toothsome beef-balls, al dente noodles, and a whole assortment of hot sauces and chiles to choose from!  And thank you for reminding me of pleasant times with old friends.

For reals though, not gonna lie, the regular bowl portion was not enough food for me.  I did end up going around the corner to Walgreen's for a Gatorade and across the street to VIP Cafe for a coconut filling bun.  So don't be shy to order an appetizer and an entree, like the aunty next us ordered the hefty fresh shrimp rolls and a noodle bowl just for herself!
author: Siu L.

description: One of my favorite places to go to when I'm in SF. The only thing I order here is their Banh Canh Cua, so yummy. The only downside is that they're inconsistent with the amount of crab meat they give you. Sometimes you get a lot, sometimes you don't. One of the pros is that they're open pretty late which is also one of the reason why I come here often when I'm in the city.
author: Binh L.

description: We came to My Canh after our NYE festivities. Luckily there wasn't much of a wait for our group of 5, but sadly it was also really crowded. My S.O. had to help break up a few fights and help another guy who was passed out on one of the tables. I feel like the quality of the Banh Canh Cua has gone down a bit, but their Bo Tai Chanh will definitely have me coming back. Thinly sliced beer capriccio seasoned to perfection with lemon, onions, and shallots. AMAZEBALLS! I've heard stories about how filthy their kitchen is, but common' you're in SF. A Vietnamese restaurant nonetheless. You are not paying for Michelin rated quality food, so get over it. The bacteria will help you grow a tougher stomach!
author: Crystal V.

description: The best raw beef salad ever! Super fresh with the right amount of tang, seasoning and garnish, a must have. You have to ask for it though because it's not on the menu. Make sure to bring cash!
author: Cindy L.

description: So ... I haven't found a better banh canh restaurant to date. I have searched northern and Southern California. Maybe one day I will find the best banh canh but for now, My Canh will do. The soup for the banh canh cua (crab udon) is not always consistent here. Sometime it's thin other times it's thick. The udon texture varies slightly as well. Overall, I have enjoyed the banh canh regardless and have been back multiple time since my last review.  Other than our usual orders for the banh canh cua, the hubby and I decided to get the egg rolls today for a change. I liked the egg rolls as they are very similar to my mom's (my mom's are still the best in my opinion). They also add some taro to the egg roll filling which I enjoyed. You get 3 egg rolls per order. Maybe next time we will try something different but for now, when I think of banh canh, want to eat banh canh... My Canh comes to mind. They also have the shrimp banh canh option if you don't want crab or want to deal with eating the crab shell on. They sometimes have banh canh with crab meat (mostly claw meat) but the last several times, they have been out when I try to order.
author: San H.

description:
So all I hear about this place is their banh canh cua!! So in hindsight, I should have ordered that instead of the Pho Tai Nam Bo Vien. It wasn't the great pho I've had, but it wasn't bad either. 

The service isn't too bad either, they are pretty nice and them opening late is always a plus! But I think that if I am in the city late I would probably stop by here again.
author: Tu-anh D.

description:
Uhh, banh canh was really oily and It wasn't that great. My friend and I had pho here too and it was decent. Not the best. 

Star for the late hours and location. Food wise... It's alright. Great if you're SUPER drunk. Lol
author: Michelle N.

description: Worst Vietnamese I've had in my life. Tasteless beef pho and the pork in the spring rolls is dry, crumbly and tastes like cardboard. Also the beef carpaccio tastes like they put in dish soap in the sauce. DO NOT GO HERE
author: Thomas W.

description: This was your typical no frills Asian atmosphere, loud and dirty. We heard they're famous for the banh can cua (crab noodle soup) so we ordered that. We also got the bo tai chanh and bun thit nuong (grilled pork, egg roll with rice noodle). The food was good except for their infamous crab noodle soup... BLAH! I've eaten a lot of noodle soups during my life but this tasted so grossss. It had barely any crab and one piece of pork.... umm that's it!? I want my $12 back!
author: Mimi L.

description:
Stumbled here last weekend on St. Patty's day from Atmosphere and was PLEASED! i always wanted to come here to try their famous crab udon soup and this place popped up at the right place right time. my drunk eyes couldnt find it on the menu so i pulled up the picture of it on my phone and showed it to the waiter. he knew right away despite how annoying i probably was.

anyway, the soup is thicker than i thought but it was so good. great flavor. 3 pieces of crab meat in there and some chunks of pork. udon noodles. delish.

i drank some of my friends regular beef pho and it was amazing. the bun bo hue is really good as well. not sure if its because i was in another zone but i wanna try it again sober.. but for now, 5 stars for making my hangover non-existant the next morning!
author: Jennifer T.

description: Just tried this place and am v disappointed. I have nothing against hole in the walls, esp where the food is amazing,  but this place has stacks of stuff (Inc huge bags of msg) everywhere in the dining area and everything looks unclean. I was squeamish about using their silverware. Ordered the crab udon soup and it was heavily thickened and there were nasty bits of black liver floating around in it. The shrimp rolls were bland and the shrimp tastes frozen and tasteless.
author: Isabelle A.

description:
I give it 3 stars cuz they don't always have the good fresh crabs for their crab noodles. But when they do have the good crab I would definitely rate it 5 stars =] sooo delicious!!

I would definately recommend this place to others. Fresh crab noodles w/ no shell!
author: Kat T.

description:
3.5
coming back into the city after a concert at oracle, i was super hungry and was pretty indecisive about what i wanted for late night eats..my friend suggested this place 

ordered:
-banh canh cua: crab noodle soup
-bbq pork dish over rice.. standard, nothing special
-beef carpaccio: the best thing here
-pho tai: ok

i preferred the soup over the rice dish so i'll be back for more late night eats and raw beef salad
author: Raquel T.

description:
I was recommended by a friend to try My Canh because I AM A HUGE BANH CANH LOVER & I normally don't like the kind with the super thick broth, but THE BANH CANH CUA (crab soup) here is SOO DELICIOUS.. Their broth is not too thick nor too watery-- it's just right. They say it's crab soup, but there's also pork in there. Ask for extra fried onions cuz it's extra tasty with it. We also tried their BO TAI CHANH (lemon raw beef) & it is by far the best I've eveer tasted. They slice the meat very thin & it is soooo flavorful! It feels like it practically melts in your mouth. 

My bf & I tried My Canh for the very first time yesterday & I'm already excited to come back to try more of their food. I've heard the bun rieu is good here.. The restaurant itself looks pretty ghetto, but I've learned to not judge a book by its cover because this place really is a hidden gem. It's also very small.. maybe only about 6-7 tables. Service was good. I thought they were very nice & quick! Prices are decent-- a lil pricier than your typical Vietnamese restaurant, but definitely worth the money. I don't think I can ever go to SF again without making a stop at My Canh first :)
author: Jenn N.

description:
Even though the rest of Chinatown could be pitch black late into the night, you can still see smoke coming out of the open kitchen with a happening crowd at My Canh. This was once my go-to place for pho when I was in high school, but my good Yelper friend Nalipay M. recently reminded me to go back and get reacquainted. I was starving after the Yelp xmas party so Cassie J and I decided to stop by. The place has not changed in years but this small hole in the wall and its sticky tables was warm, comforting, and nostalgic. There were many other yelpers that later dropped in to seek comfort food from the party, so the environment was festive with everybody busting out their phones taking pictures. In many ways, this place became the inadvertent Yelp event away from the official one.

I felt like a new customer again as I couldn't remember their menu, but their pho and rich arrays of dishes are still some of the most affordable you can find in California. Cassie and I shared an order of egg rolls ($5.25) and I also had a bowl of pho with tendon ($6.50). The egg roll tasted like it had been refried with a unsettling texture but the interior was deliciously filled with ground pork and taro. The presence of taro was strong and flavorful but I also wished the depth of the fish sauce for dipping could be a little stronger. My bowl of pho came in a bowl big enough for a steaming facial. The broth was pretty good with large pieces of slippery tendon that were very tasty. I only wished the noodles could be slightly firmer and beef could come medium rare atop of the soup. It was still very comforting and delicious nonetheless. Servings are small compared to other pho places and it was good enough to get me full.

Service was very friendly, responsive and expedient. They told us that they were opening till 3am that night and this certainly position them to be a top late night eateries in San Francisco. I would love to come back to this place and try their other items. Thanks to Cassie for bringing me here. 3.5 stars for the overall experience.
author: Daniel L.

description: This place was shown to me by my girlfriend who knew the hot spots in Downtown San Francisco.  We were coming up from Santa Cruz, Ca and was looking for a good Vietnamese cuisine and this place was it.  Thanks to my lady and Yelp, this place came up and learned that it was famous for it's "banh canh cua" (Crab udon)   Trying it out, it did not disappoint.  I do like the setting that there's a familiar setting nearby since it's on Broadway.. you know? kind of like strip club, liquor store, topless cafe, mini-mart, strip club, club...
author: Christopher N.

description:
Good place to eat Banh Canh in SF after a night of drinking. I had the Banh Canh Cua, Com bi thit nuong, and Bo tai Chanh. 

Bo tai chanh was great. Perfect blend of raw meat, mint leaves, onions and lime juice. It might seem weird to eat raw beef, but it is so good! 

The Banh canh cua was very good. The soup was very rich and flavorful. It also had pieces of crab legs which were super good and soft. 

The rice plate I had was pretty good. Nothin special. The shredded pork was a little cold but that's not a big deal.

The food is great but I need to address a problem I had about the service. The waiter at My Canh needs to learn how to be polite to customers. He did not smile at all. The whole time I was eating, he would glance over at me with a disgusted look on his face. When I went to the front to ask for a small bowl, he looked at me like he was about to fight me. He might want to change his attitude because one day, he might encounter a pissed off drunk who might give him one on the nose.

Would have been 4 stars. Minus 2 because of the service.
author: Alex N.

description:
Totally overrated!  I was so excited to come here after hearing about their crab banh canh (Vietnamese udon soup), but only to be quickly disappointed!  The banh canh cua broth was really BLAND and was thick and slimy. Don't get me wrong, I've had this type of banh canh broth before, but not like this.  It had pieces of crab (still in the shell)  that I didn't even touch because it would've been way too messy to eat.  I thought it was also odd that they had pieces of pork fat in it, weird.  My bf got the combination hu tieu xao (stir fry rice noodle) which looked really good, but the taste just wasn't there. He had to add all kinds of spices to make it more flavorful, but he still couldn't even finish the whole thing.  

My friends are disappointed I didn't like this place and said I should have gotten other things on their menu.  I don't know though, it was true hole in the wall but not for the better, OH WELL.
author: Kristina N.

description:
Typical hole in the wall Vietnamese restaurant.

This place is by far the best Banh Canh Cua in the bay. Can't go wrong with the Banh Canh Cua, or Bo Tai Chanh!

3 stars for good food. 
-1 Star for the restaurant looking completely unsanitary. 
-1 For taking no card.
author: Quyenna T.

description: cheap, and open late.  I got the crab noodle soup due to all the yelp recommendations.  At first it didn't seem THAT tasty, but as the flavors started to blend together, the taste improved and became very comforting.  I'm guessing there is quite a bit of MSG in here, as I was in dire need of water afterwards.
author: Tiffany C.

description: No. No. No no no no no.   I used to come here with friends so coming here with my girlfriend should be a routine experience. The regular thing should be just order your food, eat, pay, and leave. Not find and scoop of a fly in the pho, pull out a piece of plastic in girlfriend's pho, nor look at the flies emerge from the plate of bean sprouts. Terrible and unsanitary.
author: Gabe R.

description:
I love this place. Love it so much in fact, that I chose to eat here for over 10 years at least twice a week. During that time I was practically adopted by the family. The female family members began my conversion by feeding me all sorts of goodies that came in fresh; huge portions in fact. Much of my knowledge of Vietnamese cuisine stems from my excellent experiences here. 

Out of the hundred or so dishes that I'd tried over the years, it boils down to these as assimilating into my DNA:

Duc Cari, Com Thit Nuong, Bun thit nuong, sauteed mixed seafood on Hong Kong style noodle, Ca Kho To, Banh Cuon, Heo Xao Mì Mem, Banh Xeo, Com Ga Xao Xa Ot -And Flan, Banh Khoai Mi Nuong -or, when in season often a big plate of durian for dessert!

Gawd, how I miss this place.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Wow, I'm surprised I never have written a review for this place.... well let's just say this place rocks because it is open super late! When you want real food after a crazy night of drinking... this is the place to go. It's sort of on the smaller side so it does get really packed after all the clubs let out around Broadway. Food is decent.. it tastes amazing when you are not sober.. it's pretty dirty but you know what they say about dirty places! Dirty places = bomb.com food (most of the time!) It's sort of hard for me to give a true, legit rating for My Canh... but like I said... it's open late and the food is decent.
author: Tiff C.

description: Been coming here for years, when I was bartending and late nights out with friends or myself, would stop off here and eat up. The staff is always great and they know me, always with a smile and hello. A little run down hole in the wall but I love it and so do the people I bring there, food is great and very cheap...
author: J W.

description: I have been to this place many times, but have only had one dish.  That dish is Bún riêu and that is the best I have had so far outside of a co-worker once making it for me homemade.  This soup is so delicious that I have never ordered anything else here!  The staff here is super cool and remember me when I come in.  Love this place!
author: Hatman ..

description:
Says it's open till 2am but I came here on a Saturday night and it was open till 4am. This place is super clutch when you're hungry after a night out on the town drinking. Get a head start on that recovery. The pho was okay, nothing too special. The quality was alright and the place isn't super fancy or anything.

Gets 3 stars for being open super late, decent food and service.
author: Chris T.

description:
**CASH ONLY**

BANH CANH CUA! (Request to have the crab unshelled! so much easier to eat)
BO TAI CHANH! (request extra toppings!)
author: Christina N.

description: After a long night of drinking at the bars, my friends and I jumped into an Uber and asked the driver to bring us to pho. He said this was his favorite place and dropped us off. It was the best pho I have ever had. So much flavor and hit the spot just right at the moment. Can't wait to go back next time I am in SF.
author: Justin P.

description: Decent banh canh cua. Shredded crab aplenty. Brisk service. Wouldn't mind pippin' in if I'm north beach crawling again.
author: Anthony R.

description: Food was excellent and fulfilling we came in around 2PM and it was empy inside, we parked down the street in a parking structure on Vellejo St. We had the Banh Canh Cua with added fried egg it was delicious, the egg rolls were filled with meat. Price was OK, we came from San Jose to try this place out since our friends recommended it. We'll stop by again if we're in the area. Only thing I didn't like was the service, waitress seemed kind of rude and didn't seem to want to be there. They forgot my order of fried eggs and didn't say sorry, just an OK and it came out later.
