of all the "banh canh cua" i've had in SJ, none compared to this place...because they use real chunks of crab in the soup, which makes the broth much sweeter. other places just used canned crabs. put some hot sate chili in it and you're set for a cold day's remedy. 

that's the only thing i've ever ordered from this restaurant for the past 4-5 times i've been here. never had anything else. hence...the 3 stars...i'll update when and if i will ever order anything else. 

2 stars for the soup.
1 star for prompt service. 

bathroom is very tight and cramped. like another yelper had mentioned...they're not dirty...they're just not new. if they give the place a new paint job...things would look "cleaner". i mean, they do washed their dishes and chopsticks and wiped their tables like everyone else. so, no worries.
author: Cindi N.

description:
I've been going to My Canh for a while now, usually after a long night of drinking...I'd say I'm kind of a regular...the ladies always recognize me and say, "It's been a long time", if I haven't been in for a couple of weeks...plus when I told them I was thinking of going to Vietnam, they offered to let me stay in their house there...

But one of my biggest gripes is, for being a regular, the service has gotten worse for me...it's taking longer for me to get my food and the last time I went there, I got a half order - meaning there was less food...
The moral to this story, don't become a regular here...

Oh, the food is good too...Usually...
author: ManOverboard A.

description: Looked up this place on yelp because my girlfriend and i were looking for some pho that opened late at night. The restaurant itself is pretty gritty looking inside, but has a nice distinct Asian feel to it. The lady, which i presume is the owner, was very friendly and sat us down. My girlfriend and I ordered pho w/ steak and meatballs which turned out better than I initially anticipated. The portion was not to bad, but the price was really good for it. One thing that was off was that the lady sat us near a window that was broken did not shut so we moved to a different table that was less drafty. Overall i'd definitely come back if I was venturing in the area and craved some hot pho.
author: Euge S.

description:
Ever have dry egg noodle with mixed toppings and soup on the side? Order #8 and you will know what I'm talking about. This is real authentic vietnamese noodles that will have you coming back for more. 

The workers/owners are sweet as can be. We got to converse about trips to Vietnam and the different vietnamese cuisines they have to offer.
author: Oanh N.

description:
You'll find me here on a drunken night with my dancing buddies because it is my absolute favorite place to go after a *fun* night in the city.  

This place is super ghetto hole in the wall but their food is good.  It's always really busy between 1am and 2am; swarmed with drunkees from the clubs.  Don't expect superb service - just expect to sober up with good Vietnamese food.  Order their bo tai chanh (raw beef) and their crab pho.  Their regular beef pho is normal, nothing that stands out.  I haven't had their bun bo hue (pork blood noodle) but I hear it's pretty good.  

As long as I'm putting on my dancing heels is as long as I'll be eating here after the parties.  Yum!
author: Jess C.

description: Nasty ass phok.. I ordered "fry chicken" #47 thinking it would be fried chicken. Instead it was some damn sautéed chicken that I didn't even eat. Shhh looks gross. So I took it to go n left it outside.
author: Hizzo C.

description:
The outside is not quite as inviting as some of it's neighbors on Broadway, particularly another Vietnamese restaurant just a couple doors over, but for what they lack in decor... and lighting... they make up for in value.

You can find a pretty decent bowl of pho here, and it's quite sizable for just 5 bucks. The menu options are a little slim compared more traditional pho joints, but they have the essentials (rare steak and tendon, for me).
author: Bernie L.

description:
Need more Pho places that open late in the city.  I've eaten here a few times in the past but just recently came here again after many years away.  It was cool cause, it was open late!  Broth was good and it was not bad but I did hear that the little spot next door is better.  

Reason we didn't go there was that it was a Full House when we got there so we went to the next best thing, which is not a bad thing at all.
author: Mark W.

description: I can totally rave about this place. The food is delish, and that's coming from a vegetarian. This egg soup I requested was really really good. It wasn't over priced like the last viet restaurant I went to and tried (that place actually pissed my entire group off, won't name, names). But I do recommend this place for viet food or this other place called Pho 2000 right across from the Cova Hotel, which i believe is larkin and ellis.
author: Genneth L.

description: I had eaten here last year and the food was very tasty, but not this time. The prices are great. The Beef Chow Hofun had very little beef, and was completely bland to me. I will try this place one more time to give it the benefit of the doubt.
author: S C.

description: Ahh a late night Pho place that stays open till 2am!! The Pho here is good...sometimes its a little oily but it gets the job done for a late night Pho fix!!
author: nabil s.

description:
One of the few Vietnamese places cooked by Vietnamese chefs.  My Canh is the place we all drift to at 3AM to look for some quick grubs.  Setting is quick, get a couple pots of teas, and quick time to run through the menu.  You orders are taken quickly and in a few drunken minutes later, you see the first of your meal.  Eat well.
PS if you're eating a dry plate, be sure to ask for the extra egg on top of your rice.
author: James B.

description: The food is good. Especially the banh canh cua.... BUT BE WARNED... Check your bill because they will rip you off! Especially if it's late at night and they think your coming in from a party.
author: Thai H.

description: Their banh canh cua is the only thing I ever order here.  It is sooo delicious.  It's great on a cold day or if you happen to be in the area around 2AM on the weekends.  This is the go-to.  Oh and it is the epitome of hole-in-wall! That's where the best foods are!
author: Angela D.

description: I enjoy "Banh canh cua" here (kind of Crab with Rice Noodle)
author: Kelvin T.

description: dirty hole in wall joint. don't expect great service here by any means. you got flies flying around and the walls and floors looks as if it wasn't cleaned for years. BUT they do make it up in their soups. note i said soups - all other rice dishes and whatnot are not that good. Banh Canh Cua (rice noodle w/ crab meat) is hands down one of the best i've ever had. home cooked style meal (with MSG). simply delicious. sweet savory flavors, perfect taste on a cold day in frisco.
author: Nam N.

description:
0NE STAR 0FF F0R THE CLEANLiNESS 0F THiS PLACE.  H0WEVER, THE F00D MAKES UP F0R iT.  THE PH0 B0 iS H0T, CHEWY G00DNESS!  i CAN`T EVER GET EN0UGH 0F iT.  

i ALWAYS 0RDER THE B0 TAi CANH [LEM0N RAW BEEF] THERE.  iT`S N0T 0N THE MENU, && iT`S $12 A PLATE, BUT DEFiNiTELY W0RTH EVERY PENNY && W0RTH EVERY BiTE.  iT`S RAW BEEFY, LEM0NY G00DNESS WiTH RAW 0Ni0NS [WHiCH i PiCK 0UT, CUZ i HATE RAW 0Ni0NS] && FRiED GARLiC 0N T0P.  HEAVEN!  *DR00LS*
author: Dee W.

description:
Came here after Rosewood Lounge closed about a block away. They get two stars for being accommodating (as in squeezing ten chairs around a small round table so we can all fit) and for opening late (it was about 2am). But that's it. 

Three stars taken away for:
- Inefficient service (had to ask for tea / more bowls multiple times in different languages; and it didn't help that the waiter had a unfriendly attitude when we took a bit longer than usual in trying to figure out the bill)
- Unreasonable charges (we had a few people who didn't want to order anything - they were just part of the group and wanted to chill - but My Canh charged each of these people a "service fee" for just sitting there and not buying anything. This made paying the bill a bit harder since no one wants to pay $ for just sitting in a restaurant and drinking tea.)
- Sanitation (dirty tables, flies, generally not clean.) 

Oh, and the Shrimp Spring Rolls I ordered basically had half a shrimp in each roll. I guess that's pretty standard...but it also did not taste very good. Eh.
author: April Z.

description: I actually came to this pho place mistakenly thinking it was the 4 star pho place next door during one of my druken nights. Being adventurous, I decided to get the Mongolian rice plate which was recommended by the server. It was not good even in my druken state. The only thing good about this place is that the food is served instantly.
author: Jason K.

description:
My absolute favorite. Best pho in the entire City! Awesome food!

Yeah, it's a fly specked pit, but get over it. If the place didn't have grade C in the window it wouldn't be real. cockroaches are just for entertainment. And yes, women who enter the "bathroom" here seldom return - it's an evil white closet covered in multiple coats of paint - a bright, glaring horror with few paper products and insect life galore - (cue Vincent Price) "beware!"

But the food is f**kin' awesome!

Formica tables, newly recovered chairs (I was eating there while they were recovering them about a year ago). A total dive - not a table cloth in sight. But for the quality of the food and the price you cannot beat it. Service always is good (it's a family restaurant). Bring cash though - no credit cards or checks.

Parking is a trial, like everywhere else in this messed up City. But find some curb and walk over here and you will understand.

And it's pronounced "fuh" not "foh" or "foo"

Get the "cafe su da" - iced Vietnamese coffee - and you will know the equivalent of heterosexual pleasure in a glass.

Awesome Pho!
author: Gregory M.

description:
This place is a dive! And, I love it!

And, it's open late (2-3 am), every night!

So far, in my quest for the perfect bowl of Bún bò Hu the most boring food has been in the prettiest restaurant.

The food here is crude and greasy, but it's delicious. There wasn't a lot of meat in my Bún bò Hu, but it was yummy.

The "V-C Egg Rolls" (Imperial Rolls) were greasy, but delicious! Probably the best Imperial Rolls I can remember.

Cash only!
author: BigJohnS F.

description: Good Pho place that opens late.  The Crab Pho is pretty good with chewy noodles.  Just watch out for your fellow diners... who might still be a little tipsy.
author: Jim J.

description: Love their Bo Tai Chahn!!  This place is open late nights too till 3am.  Just beware on weekends with drunken fools.
author: Patrick C.

description:
i've only come here for the banh canh cua and nothing else.... never tried anything else on the menu because the banh canh cua is soooooo delish! the fresh coconut i had was pretty bland but who cares?! banh canh cua all the way!

by far the best place that serves banh canh cua in SF
author: L M.

description: Whole in the wall place, this is the spot where u can come for lunch, which u got better luck finding parking or for 3am after a fun night of getting loose with your goose. Their banh canh cua, bo tai chanh, bun thit nuong, pho, everything is SUPER  DELICIOUS.  Doesn't matter if you're drunk or sober the food still taste good.
author: tahni c.

description: bo tai chanh and crab noodle soup, so bomb!
author: Connie Y.

description:
This place gets stars, because they open late! So where do you go eat after clubbin in the city, when you don't want pizza, lucky penny, or chinese food.... you go get ph ahaha.. 

The ph wasn't all that great. The Bowl was small.. i ordered an extra large! i was like a small.. wth... the noodles were clumped all together.. but the brother was pretty good.. maybe i was just buzzed. 

A lot of drunk people come here after the clubs, so beware of annoying girls.
author: Brian P.

description: Really good food.  Like other reviewers said try the thick crab soup with rice noodles, that's their specialty.  Also their cha gio is really good.  They are full of meat and they use the rice paper instead of the egg roll wrapper, which I prefer.  Everything else is done right, like their bun chao... My only complaint is the location and cleanliness.. please move to newer location!
author: Ethan C.

description: Came here with some girlfriends to try their famous banh canh cua.Ehhhh I have had better. Small hole in the wall, actually worse than a hole in the wall. Don't get me wrong, the banh canh wasn't bad, but I could get better in San Jose.
author: Jennifer D.

description: My second time here after long night of drunken shenanigans. Despite the shady looking environment, the food here is surprisingly decent. Depending on the time you show up, there may be a wait, but the turn over is fairly quick. I had the Bo Tai Chanh and Banh Canh Cua. At first I was hesitant to try the raw beef, but it turned out to be amazing. Definitely a must get. The Banh Canh broth is a bit too thick for my liking, but they well make up for it with the flavor.
author: David T.

description:
another after the club joint. i want to give this spot a four star but just couldnt. 3.5 would of been perfect. reason why ..

drunk visits - delicious! finger licking good!

sober visits - why would anyone eat this? seriously? i was here sat night and i ate the whole bowl? sh#t!

ill be back! and i will definately be drunk =P
author: Frankie L.

description:
When I lived in North Beach, I'd come here all the time for their spring rolls and bun with chicken/beef. I've taken many friends there who don't mind the funky atmosphere or grimy kitchen, as it's open really late hours and everything's very cheap. 

Over the years, I only had one really bad experience here in which I ordered noodles and discovered very early on in eating it that some of the veggies: bean sprouts and cucumbers in the salad were spoiled and thus, spoiled the whole dish.  I tried to explain this to the waitress/owner and she refused to listen, give me a new dish or refund. After being such a regular customer for so many years, it upset me that she wouldn't even listen or try to correct the problem.  I haven't been back since.
author: Melissa G.

description:
As the pre-existing Yelp message says for two stars: Meh. I've experienced better.

Came here for dinner last night - good times because of the company, but not the food. It's ok. I had been once before and thought it was decent, which it still is, but I'm not sure I'd return after paying more attention to all the food. I just had a plate of stir fried veggies which was good enough, but  my rice was a little oblong shaped and strange - like it was bloated with water. My friends had pho, and the bean sprouts and basil did not look very fresh at all. My friend also felt sick when he got home that night. Eeks!
author: serena l.

description: I order the number sixteen the beef with ho fun.  It was good the service was fast.  It was cheap and filling.  Went with a friend to eat after work.  Its crowded here on Saturday because people finsh clubbing around 2 o'clock am.  Police arrest a drunk outside on the street i think he was talking shit to the cops and was drunk.
author: John F.

description: Most of the dishes taste good, actually my favorite was the curry tofu. The fresh spring rolls were good too. The kitchen is right there. I like when I can see the food being made. I take two stars off for the roaches. I have seen them on 3 separate occasions and after the 3rd time stopped going here to eat. I know roaches are tough to get rid of but at least make the effort. I don't like eating when I see roaches.
author: Joy H.

description: Dirty inside but yummy and delicious food.  Bring cash, they don't take cards.
author: Nick B.

description:
I work somewhat nearby and have typically gone to Sai's for Vietnamese food. It's good but can be kind of an ordeal waiting for a table at lunchtime. My Canh lacks the lobsters and silk plants that decorate the interior of Sai's. My view was of the drink refrigerator, so I was staring at cans of iced coffee and coconut juice.

Anyhow, I mainly want to talk about the bun (vermicelli noodle salad). I ordered it with chicken and imperial rolls. Good lord, how can a 2lb bowl of noodles topped with a deliciously greasy egg roll seem so light and fresh? Man, it must be all the mint leaves they throw in there. The chicken was grilled and tasted super fresh and tender. The greasy egg roll was crispy, juicy, perfect. Not only did My Canh's bun beat Sai's bun, it miraculously didn't set me to sleep for 2 hours. I am definitely returning.
author: Carin R.

description:
The dirtier the better tasting!  That's the rule of thumb for Asian restaurants!  This place follows that rule!  You walk in, and it just looks dirty, but the food is delicious and plentiful.  The only times the portions look small is when it's 2 am on a Fri/Sat and the place is packed with drunk people.  

Was here just 2 hours ago, and they said they open 'til 3 am on a Sunday!  WTF?  Wow.  I ordered the Bun Rieu and my buddy ordered some pho.  We shared an order of Vietnamese egg rolls.  The Bun Rieu was very flavorful and full of meat.  I normally don't drink the broth/soup, but finished it tonight.  The egg rolls were decent, but seems like they use a lot of taro in it.  All in all, the meal came out to $22 (before tip).

If you're in Chinatown after a drunken night of partying or just hanging out, check this place out.  Try the Bun Rieu, and even the Banh Xeo.  You really can't go wrong unless you get the runs.  So far so good...

One more thing:  CASH ONLY.
author: Daniel M.

description: Nothing too special about this place. I've only gone here after a night of drinking since they're open late. Pho after a few drinks.... YUM!
author: Lucy A.

description:
This is one of my favorite places for Pho.  Period.  The prices are super cheap and the food is super delicious.  I really want to give this place 5 stars, but I have to consider the restaurant as a whole and not just for their food.

This place sits on the outskirts of Chinatown and when you walk inside, it's a very typical Chinatown restaurant.  Small, kinda dingy, hole in the wall sorta place, home to some of the best pho anywhere in the bay area (however, a VERY reliable source told me about a place in Oakland that's a notch up).  

I've been here several times and I usually order the #19,  or #18.  I also add the Lemon Raw Beef (not on the menu) when I eat here with some friends.  It's 12 bucks but HELLA worth it!  It's superfantastic and the plate is enough for 3 people.  I have tried several other dishes, but the #19 and #18 are my favs.  The broth is savory and the noodles are perfect.  

A couple of drawbacks are parking and the atmosphere.  Both are not very pleasant.  But hey, do you want good pho, or what?
author: Tom Y.

description:
I don't even know why me and my bff come here so often. Its horrible!! oh i know! Its one of the only pho place that opens late....

Its pretty dirty here... but what can you expect from a chinatown restaurant.  

The pho isnt the best and they charge extra for beef on the side. Waiters can be rude sometimes. 

This place would be a 2 star if it didn't open late. I would go somewhere else if there where more late pho places.
author: woon t.

description:
4 stars for late night pho that tastes decent. It's not the best pho around, but it's the best pho around late at night. My pho tai was pretty big....worth the $6.75 I paid. But...having a third bowl of soup noodles in one day probably wasn't one of my better ideas.

Late night pho craving? Around Broadway? This is where you should go.
author: Tiff L.

description: Bo Tai Chanh here is the best I've have eaten at so far. The Banh Canh Cua is good here too, alot of my friends hyped it up before we got there and I think it lived up to the hype. I would definitely return and go more often if it was closer. The parking for this spot sucks thought and the restaurant is kinda small to be coming in with a large group.
author: Tony D.

description:
Open LATE.! A must for a night of clubbing and drinking. The warm flavorful broth will sooth your stomach from all the alcohol.

Most good pho places look a little sketchy. 

3 stars because you couldn't take a date here, but open late, good food, cheap prices.
author: Diane H.

description: it's dirty, small, and gets crowded during the peak hours after the bars/clubs. but there's something magical about two dishes here. these two dishes has made me a loyal customer for the last 8 or so years. banh canh cua aka the crab noodle soup and bo tai chanh raw beef salad is the business here!! i absolutely hate driving to sf but for some my canh i never mind and actually the one that suggests it every chance i get. the only reasons i can't give it the 5th star is because even though it's good, these two dishes has nearly doubled in price and portions are much smaller now. lastly, i hate that there's enough toilet paper to last another decade but never any hand towels to dry your hands and forehead sweat cause sriracha is the only condiment you'll be needing..
author: Alex F.

description: Dont patronize this RACIST ASS PLACE. These are some of the most racist places you can ever eat at if you are black. I was there 11/27/11 at about 9.10pm and this waitress was snnering and scoffing at me the whole time. They treat you like you are a criminal.. DONT GO HERE AND I REPEAT DONT GO HERE IF YOU ARE BLACK. RACIST RACIST RACIST.
author: John m.

description:
If you get past the dirty looking interior, you'll be eating at one of the best pho places in SF. I recommend 19 (spicy, pork) and 21 (tomato base soup, crab meat). To cool you down, go for one of their iced coffees with condensed milk.

It also helps if you know the waitresses and the cooks really well because they tend to be very generous with the meat, noodles, and vegetables when they know you a little better. There's a few times I can't finish the bowl of noodles because they give too much. This is one pho place where I didn't have to drink gallons and gallons of water to quench my MSG-caused thirst.
author: Darren L.

description: Late late night restaurants in North Beach are so necessary after a night of raging. A good mix of Vietnamese and Chinese food. Very satisfying noodle soups and crispy noodles. The crab v.n. noodle was awesome with a nice bold broth and crab pieces (still in shell). Watch out for the pig blood curds though if you're scared of unfamiliar ingredients. This place is a key drunk dining destination for the Asian population. A little over-packed late at night.
author: Ed L.

description: Good Bun (vermicelli bowl) in the northbeach area.  I get the grilled beef and shrimp with additional cost I add an egg roll to it.  I live 2 blocks away so i go a few times a week.
author: Jasen L.

description: Their banh canh cua is delicious!!!! Perfect after a long nite of alcohol consumption! This place is super small and gets very crowded after the clubs and bar ends so get their early!
author: Diana L.

description: Pretty good hole-in-the-wall place for decent filling Vietnamese food after clubbing or partying. I like that they're open really late and are willing to stay open depending on the amount of people waiting in line. The service is prompt and friendly. It's a better alternative if you're tired of eating Denny's or Jack in the Crack for the late night munchies.
author: Jean P.

description: great place to grab a quick bowl of pho right after clubbing on broadway... remember close 2am so walk over and order... the pho is on the small bowl size but its ok... you tell me where else can you pho at this time and hour?! lucky chance?! haha...
author: JessePanda C.

description: Hungover, wandering along broadway is how I discovered this place. Pho is one of my cravings when I am in a state such as this, and this place seemed to be a godsend at first.  And then I walked inside the door.  Cash only, check.  Filthy, cluttered space, check.  Rare beef pho, I'll take that sir.  Service was impersonal, but pretty quick.  I asked for extra limes and that took about 5 minutes even though there were only a few people in the restaurant.  But the pho broth was pretty darn tasty and it definitely hit the spot for me.  But this place was really dirty...
author: William B.

description: Decent pho, nothing amazing but 2 stars for being open until 3 am
author: Shawn A.

description: I think I misordered here. I got the crap soup with yolky broth. Way too yolky for my liking to the point it felt inedible. I don't think anyone wants to drink a whole bowl of raw egg yolk considering I hardly ever eat cooked yolk in the first place!
author: Jeanne C.

description: I should really take 2 stars away because of cleanliness of this place, but I like how this place is opened late! I've seen rodents, spiders and cockroaches here plenty of times, but if you come here drunk, them little creepy crawlers won't be noticed. Anyway, I love their Lemon Beef here! (Raw Beef). I think the flavors are by far the BEST I've ever had in the city! Most places only use basil, but this places uses the real vietnamese mint, its so fragrant and I love it!
author: A L.

description:
this place is okay (re: three stars), but i'm giving it an extra star for being open so late.
their imperial rolls are so so.  the stuffing is kinda bland and too much of it.  their pho broth was good, but their noodles were cold & hard and so it broke into little itty pieces and also didn't taste very good.
author: H. L.

description: My friend has introduced me to my first Vietnamese CRAB NOODLE SOUP (or is it called crab soup noodle??) N.E.way :) I am hooked! We cannot find anywhere else that would make such delicious, rich, tasty, sumptuous, thick crab noodle soup! I absolutely heart this item and I missed it immensely because we haven't been there for maybe over a year now... These pictures are making me hungry....!!!! This place is not fancy but I always feel they open late to feed people like us lol.. you know, exhausted, hungry who want their food NOW. I remember the speedy service, they always give you tea from that big tank... and we all appreciate that after a crazy night out trying to sober up haha.
author: Bella A.

description: Delicious! Dropped by for some late night Pho after dropping of some friends to the airport late tonight. Great! Had the number 29, steak and meatball pho. Broth was yummy, spring rolls were a little on the herb-y side, but still very delicious. Overall, great hole in the wall. Glad we found it, we know where we'll be coming for Pho in the future.
author: Ngaolia C.

description: This restaurant is open late ( I think whoever works here never sleep). It's a great place to eat after a night out at the clubs. This is kind of a dingy little place. The food is average, but I never do care that much since I'm usually starving after a night of debauchery..... I've had the Bun Bo Hue and it seems to taste better when I'm buzzed. I've had the Bun Rieu and did not like it at all. It tasted like really old broth that had been sitting out for a couple of days. What I really like here is Bo Tai Chanh, it always seems to be fresh here. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for a late night meal with friends.
author: carebear l.

description: LOVE THEIR FOOD.......Banh Canh Cua .....THE BEST.....different from any other restaurants i've ate at.
author: Save M.

description: I think I had the #29 but don't quote me on that.. and at 3am, it was nothing but delicious!!!  The place is dingy, but the food was good, and it hit the spot and kept my hangover the next day to a mere minimum.  Really, it's probably only worth 4 stars, but the extra star is for being open so damn late.  I'm sorry for the short recollection of events here, It was a bit of a late night, that involved too many drinks waiting for my turn at the karaoke bar, and so the experience didn't leave a huge impression... but the pho sure did.  I'm looking forward to another late night of drinking just so I can jump in when someone complains that there's nothing good to eat in SF late at night.
author: Luba M.

description:
I decided to come here today because I've read some pretty good reviews here on yelp about the crab noodle soup. I was surprised at the large bowl it came in...it was a pretty large portion, with some crab meat, pork, pork blood..etc.The broth was kinda thick, and sadly it doesnt have much taste to it....the only part i liked was the fried garlic/onions they added. 

Other than that, I would like to mention this old man sat at my table and talked to me the whole friggin time I was eating. Yes, he's a stranger and I DO NOT know him---but he was friendly and nice. ....and creepy. pretty awkward o_o.
author: Broc L.

description: Don't come here for the pho, do come for the banh canh cua or the thick  crab noodle soup.  Rich and hearty with udon like noodles.  First time I came here sober too!
author: A L.

description: My friends and I usually stumble into this place after a night out on the town. I've tried their crab noodle soup and pho which was alright, but they serve the best raw lemon beef (bo tai chanh) around!  And it's a great dish to sober you up.
author: Maryann B.

description: I loooove Pho and SF Weekly voted it the best...but the pho here wasn't good.  Pho Hana in Diamond Bar (So Cal) is by far the best.
author: Kristen H.

description: About a bit over a year ago the portions for the banh canh cua (crab noodle soup) was pretty nice size and you would get half a crab. But now you would be lucky if you even get three little pieces of it. The ownership keeps changing back and forth and that just kills the quality of the food.  Lately i heard that the signature dish is starting to suck and get really pricey.
author: Art N.

description:
Food for a meal. Decent.
Food for a drunken night. Good.
Service is pretty bad, but if you can get over that, go there at 2 in the morning to get your pho fix.
author: Jimmy N.

description: When I'm in the city and craving for some noodle soup, I like to come here. Typical vietnamese restaurant, very small, maybe a little dirty, but food is delicious! I love their banh canh cua, Bo tai chanh and pho.  they open very late so it's a good spot to go after a late night outing. Definitely arrive before 2 am if you want to beat the crowd.
author: Cindy C.

description: Eww, dirty. But when its 2am and you're wasted, its the best pho you have ever had in your life.
author: Candy C.

description: Considering its appearance as a dingy hole in the wall, this place serves up some great and cheap thai.  It's not spectacular, but considering the price, as well as the sense of eliteness you get from knowing this place exists, its worth it.
author: Herbert S.

description: My favorite place to go in sf after a night of clubbing. My friend has the restaurant on her cell phone speed dial, so she calls right when we leave the club to let them know we're coming and how many bowls to prepare. This is the only place I know that uses whole dungenous crab legs in their soup. OMG the flavors of sweet crab legs sauteed in onions and seasoning and thrown in a bowl of thick crabby broth- YUM! It's a hole in the wall, but I give it 5 stars for making Banh Canh that's truly like no other, minus one for being absolutely filthy (I'm not sure I would eat there during the day when I'm wide awake and sober).
author: Jacki E.

description: Very hot food, that's a good thing. Chow neon was good but not enough shrimp in it. My wife thought the pho wasn't flavorful but, once she seasoned it, it was darn rtasty. Veggie spring rolls were solid but not spectacular.  There must be better pho in the city and we are going to be in search of it
author: Todd Z.

description: This place gets an extra star since its open at 3am and perfect way to cap off a night of drinking. The soup has the full beef flavor and the noodles are fresh. My homie Don skooled me on this spot almost 15 yrs ago and nicknamed it "Death Row Pho" since it attracts all the late night gangsta types after 1am.
author: Roger Y.

description:
I had to try the Banh Canh Cua (Crab Noodle Soup) after reading the reviews on here.  Unlike the rest of you party people, I went at 11am for a little post booze viet hangover curing.

Clearly I'm super-caucasian because the first thing our server said to me was "Do you want the blood in it?"  No, thank you.  I'm adventurous and such but I just don't care for it.  That said, it was good overall, tons of really yummy crab.  My friend had Pho Tai and it was good, but the broth wasn't as potent as I'd hoped for and the beef wasn't as rare as it should be.  Hell, it was early, I'd love to come here late.

That said, I appreciated the place and the service.
author: T. R.

description:
my late night fix for my canh was horrible!

while taking our order, my friend spoke to the waitress in vietnamese, and the lady spoke to her in cantonese, so I tried to help translate, then when i ordered my food, she spoke to me in vietnamese.  while that was a minor mishap, we ordered cold water for the table.  five minutes passed, ten minutes passed, our food came out (which i admit is good), and still no water.  we asked again, and again, no water.  we practically finished our meals and two cups of water came out for a table of five people eating.  finally the bill came out it was about 23 dollars for two drinks, and 3 bowls of noodle.  this place did not take credit cards, so we scrambled our money and got 27 dollars, a measely tip, but for the lack of service given, it was more than they should've got.  we leave the bill on the table with the money and head outside the restaurant to mingle, and the waitress comes out and talks in vietnamese to me (i don't speak vietnamese) and keeps pointing to the cans of drinks and says "two, two, two" and points to it on the bill, which we paid for.  being so aggravated, a friend from another table gave her two dollars more to stop the harrassment.  

to sum it all up, our other friend told us that the same thing has happened to them prior. 

so BEWARE, make sure you check your bill!!!!

and yes the food is decent...but you're better off buying it to go
author: jessica y.

description: The staff here is cute and they whip up the food in a flash.  I have been going there for a while now.  I love their banh canh cua, beef stew & chow fun, mi kno (with the large egg noodle), banh xeo w/ rice paper, and my FAV  bo thai chanh (vietnamese version of beef carpaccio). Writing this blog is making me hungreeeeee =)
author: linda h.

description: This was the type of place that just didn't care about the quality of its food.  The pho broth--the defining characteristic of pho--was bland.  The beef was ok ... but there was too little of it.  Also, the accompanying mint leaves were wilted.  I expect my pho shacks to look unappealing, I wouldn't have it any other way.  And I may even be upset if it were too cleanly ... just wouldn't fit.  But just b/c I want it down and dirty doesn't mean that I left my tastebuds at home.
author: Paul K.

description: I love this restaurant.  The food is pretty good but the people who run it are really nice.  Once I forgot my money and they just told me to pay next time.  Another time I left my glasses there and they saved them for me.  Food is pretty good, decor a little funky but its a good place to relax and watch broadway pass by.
author: Mark P.

description: My favorite place for lunch in the North Beach area. The Pho is delicious, the V-N eg rolls are delicious, and the meat is high quality. Sure the place is small and worn and the people working there don't speak much English. Sure I've eaten there a dozen times but still always get confused about whether to just seat myself or wait for them to do it. And sure I accidentally ordered tripe soup once and was way way way too grossed out to eat it and ended up picking it out of the broth with my chopsticks -- shame-faced when the guy came to take my plate away. None of that matters, because on a windy day My Canh's Pho is the perfect respite from work, wind, anything. Plus, it's cheap as hell.
author: Emily F.

description: The beef carpaccio is sooo good here.  So is the bun rieu.  This is the best Viet restaurant in Chinatown and it's a great place for a buzz fix after the bars!
author: Jen A.

description:
i would've gave them 5 stars has it not been for the cleanlisness of the place...
The food is good... my love goes to the banh canh cua... yummy yummy, so authentic-like,... I've never found another place that makes banh canh like they do in VN!!! anywayz... I've been there for about 4-5 times already, and out of that 4-5 times, 3 of those time, they sat me next to the bathroom.... 
wtheck?
but i asked them to move, so they were ok with it...
so learn my lesson, don't sit near the bathroom and you'll enjoy the food more!!!
author: nailil i.

description: It's a tiny dirty restaurant in Chinatown.  But, oh gosh, they have the best "banh canh cua" anywhere.
author: Jenny P.

description:
ehh. nothing about this place impresses me. the place is pretty dayuum GROSS, as in dirty. i thought the food was gonna make up for it, but NAAAHH. i believe i had the banh canh cua. *sigh* well, you cant expect  much from north bay vietnamese joints anyway.

not very professional. they use the front of the place as a stock room LOL. cardboard boxes like everwhere and nothing looks really fresh from the start.  i wouldnt come here unless youre REALLY desperate for vietnamese food and you're stuck in frisco. drive south for 10 minutes and hit up Pho The Gioi in South SF. they dont have banh canh cua, but they got all basics down.
author: Dennis C.

description:
I'm a regular at this place.  As of last week I would've still given this place 4 stars.  

Not to get me wrong, their food is bomb!  I'm a total fan of their bun rieu (crab meat noodle soup) here.  Hands down, it's one of the best bun rieu in the city.  

As of service, meh!!!  Last week my boyfriend and I came here and ordered 2 bun rieus.  Apparently they heard we wanted some beef noodles instead.  One waitress brought out the beef noodles and we were like WTH, we didn't order that.  We want our BUN RIEU!!! She was just standing there looking at me, and pressuring me to just accept that beef noodles.  NO!!! I don't want it! I WANT MY BUN RIEU!  
10 minutes later, she brings our "bun rieu".  Well it sure tasted weird....... They just used the same soup from the beef noodles we rejected, tossed some tomatoes, poured some fish sauce and just re-served it to us.  It didn't taste ANYTHING like the bun rieus we normally eat here. They skimped on the portion.  They didn't give us the lettuce shreds, and worse of all, they tossed in the bean sprouts for me (I know it's weird, but I eat my viet noodles without bean sprouts).  So i spent much of time picking it back out.  

-_- Seriously, I wonder if I pissed the ladies off enough that they'll add in "extras" to my orders from now on.  I should stay away from this place for a while.  

BTW, their bathroom is super gross (perhaps one of the worse in chinatown, as if it can't get any worse.  It totally looks like a scary movie set.
author: Emily L.

description: It's decent food at reasonable prices.  Basically my go-to place for pho in north beach.
author: Brian S.

description: The food wasn't bad.  I had the beef noodle stew and it was pretty good.  But, the restaurant just feels a little dirty.  Also, I'm really not a fan of the lace curtains they hang on the windows.  It's a petty point, but I sat by the window and ended looking straight at them the whole time.
author: Raz R.

description: mMM my canh is the shizzzzz!! place is a little small but the service is really nice.. so of course their banh canh cua has to be good, but besides that, i really recommend the bo tai chanh which is semi-raw beef cooked with lemon juice and herbs. oh yes, and with FISHSAUCE!! Mmm. this place is especially good on a cold rainy day/night, or even maybe after clubbing and you feel like some grub!
author: kim p.

description: great cheap pho. i rarely stray from the pho tai. and i love the iced coffee. perfect for the workday hang-over.
author: Dean E.

description: just bought fresh spring rolls and the fact that they do make it as you order is super!  not much meat, but lots of fresh veggies.  which is good.  and the price is not bad, $4.95.  how can you beat that.
author: Food Is L.

description: Twas mediocre and my pho clumped up as well. My mother was rather pissed off at the sight of a clump of pho after i nagged her to have lunch there.
author: cindy L.

description: BO TAI CHANH!!! thats all i could say ... not a big fan of Banh canh cua but it still delicious with its style of cooking with the actual crab in it rather than being gutted... although they have change up the style of the bo tai chanh plate. it still delicious and worth the late night drive for
author: timmy p.

description: lets get to it....you're walking down broadway in chinatown lookin for a good but cheap place to get some grub. you see some shops for knick knacks and you seem some stores for...well nobody knows but they're there. you come to my cahn. you think wtf is up with this...ever hear of cleaning products... its JANKY no doubt about it. but you need to go in order and try the stuff. they are the real deal. thats vietnamese stuff there. the main waiter doesnt speak all too well in english and cant understand chinese very well so good luck but that doesnt matter. they give you big portions, the food is great, and you finish off rubbing your tummy after a big FULFILLING meal. burp it out...thats what everybody else does in the restaurant. honestly, after a few times of enjoying their great, fantastic, magnificent food, you dont even notice the jankiness of the whole place and you love the restaurant for what it is...a viet place =], sometimes if you're lucky you get to hear the waiters and cooks talk it out in their dialect almost as if they're arguing and then they come out with big smiles. puts a smile on my face after such a funny moment.
author: Dexter L.

description: a whole in the wall but it opens late and has great crab noddle soup. service is not very good but hey, i get good tasting crab soup with real crab!
author: Lynne O.

description: this is hands down my favorite Vietnamese spot in the city. don't let the faded exterior fool you, their food is legit. i frequent this place at least once a week. all of the staff members remember my order and are very friendly when i come in.of all the dishes i have tried here my hands down favorite is their pho. i have consumed a lot of different types of pho, but the broth that they produce is the best i have had anywhere in the city. i feel like they don't dumb any of the flavors down. a lot of Asian spots don't go all in with their flavors just to accommodate the American palate. here, no way. their broth is rich and flavorful. their Thai basil is the freshest i have seen at any pho spot. their portions, to me, are the perfect size to fill me to a satisfied full. i could go on about this place for hours, but you just have to go there yourself and try it! trust me, you wont be disappointed.
author: Rebecca Q.
